title: Great location
text:
Stayed here on a Saturday night with my wife and daughter. Hotel was clean, trendy and well located for the lower East side. People were friendly-especially Vidia at the front desk.
Coffee set up in the lobby- but at 7:30, still no fresh coffee out!

title: Great location at a reasonable price
text: This is a groovy hotel. It situated in a great location at a reasonable price. It is in walking distance to some good places to eat. The staff were friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend if after good value for money.

title: Perfect location for a New York trip
text:
Perfectly located as a starting point for sight seeing. Little Italy and China town around the corner. Financial destrict with Wallstreet close by. The Metro will take you to the other important points in a couple of minutes. Try the italian restaurant "Piacere" next door and enjoy great food. For shopping it is a short walk to Braodway Street and the streets around. 
A great place to go.

title: Nice Room For Large Family In City
text: We stayed here for two nights with our 3 teenage boys during their spring break. The room was large of enough for the five of us, 2 queens and a twin. We didn’t spend much time in the room so it worked out fine. Room was clean and nicely decorated. I loved the exposed brick wall and the beds were decent. A bit pricey but it was to be expected for NY. Parking was about 3 blocks away and was in a lot where they park your car for you. Be sure to let them know you’re staying at Sohotel to get a discounted price. The location was perfect we’re in the middle of Little Italy and China Town with easy access to the subway (the boys loved that).The only reason I gave this a 4 was because the tiles in the bathroom had some leftover hair from previous stay but other than that the bathroom was clean and updated. Easy check in/out. Staff was nice and accommodating. Great stay overall for first time visit to NY.

title: I will stay here again
text:
Great location downtown/Bowery etc if that is where you want to be. ( Subway close so you can go everywhere easy ) 
Room was on the smaller side but it was just me, bathroom was pristine, check in and out smooth, it was just a good NYC hotel experience, prices ..well that is an individual thing but for me it was value for money.
My room was on the inside, not towards the street so I can not say anything about the NYC ambience that is all over...and which is a part of the NYC experience. Just embrace it.
Nice loungelike entrance so to be able to get a coffea had been nice but then again, why stay there when NYC is just outside...
Good to know is tthat here are no elevators, only stairs - and it was one of the reason I wanted to stay there, then again, it is only 4 floors....I think.

title: Fantastic Location for Families
text: We travelled with our 3Kids to New York City. Choose The Sohotel because it fit our needs. The room was perfect. Everything was nice and clean. The Kids loved it. Just a short walk to the Metro. Beautiful Location. Nice staff. Super friendly. We will come back for sure!

title: Fun and funky vibe - great location!
text:
Fun, funky boho vibe - great location - 
We had a really enjoyable two night stay!
The staff were all super friendly and helpful and the lobby and room were very clean.

This is a better priced option than many of the hotels in the area as well. It seems all NYC hotels are charging ‘resort’ fees - so I suggest that you be sure to look at the total charges carefully before booking - thankfully, the hotel website and most booking sites seem to be clear about any added fees – if we pay attention.

The decor at Sohotel is colorful, fun and funky - unless you are craving brand new – (there are several newer hotels in the area, some quite trendy!) – this hotel has a warm, boho feel that is homier than a big chain – if you aren’t going to miss the points you may earn with a big chain, this is a nice alternative.

We enjoyed the complimentary coffee and hot water/tea each morning- although the hotel website mentions water availability in the lobby - be sure to ask one of the very friendly staff members – there is no water dispenser set out in the lobby after the coffee and tea are removed. 

The bed was quite comfortable, there was a safe in the room and the ceiling fan and temperature controls all worked well.
C.O. Bigelow shampoo, conditioner and shower gel available in the bathroom were all very nice – the lavender mint scent is subtle, herbal-fresh without being overpowering – I would have purchased these if they were available! (C.O. Bigelow is a classic NYC pharmacy - but it's not close to the hotel).

I feel I should mention that the Standard Queen room was a bit cramped – we felt we got a decent deal and were ok with it – but if that’s an issue I’d advise booking a bigger room. From the website I gather the premium rooms have refrigerators – I would have loved a hot water kettle right in the room – but that’s down to my endless tea habit.

The location is very convenient to multiple subway lines – in good weather the walk from the hotel’s edge of East Village/NoLita location to SoHo and even Chelsea is enjoyable. We loved that many really nice plant-based restaurants abound in the area and there is a Whole Foods within easy walking distance that is open until 10pm.

Although check-in times are listed as 4pm - it seems post-pandemic, check-in times have shifted later from the usual pre-pandemic 3pm – the hotel sent an email of the morning of our stay requesting our estimated arrival and we were able to check in at 3 – which we really appreciated. Due to helpful staff, we were able to check out at 11:30 am instead of the stated 11:00 am checkout time at no charge. We were also offered free luggage storage on check-out - which we didn’t need – but it was nice to have the offer. Overall, the very friendly and accommodating staff helped to make our visit enjoyable.

title: Family friendly stay
text: We loved our stay here! Perfect location for our family of 5. We had fun exploring the neighborhood and it’s an easy walk to subways for sightseeing. The room was quite small, but clean and comfortable with a nice lower lobby to lounge in.

title: Comfortable hotel in good area, you can walk to many interesting neighborhoods.
text: Room not large, but clean and with everything you need, super comfortable bed, comfortable bathroom. The staff very kind. I recommend the area because it is close to many interesting neighborhoods. You can walk to the city center. Good experience.

title: Amzing & Beautiful
text: The hotel was clean, smelled good. Different areas for relaxing and social interactions. Love the fact that I brought a speaker and did not need it for the room because it came with a sound bar easy to connect. warm bathroom floors were top tier! Just a great stay!

title: Great value
text: The deluxe family suite was perfect for our party of five.  The room was incredibly insulated and we heard no noise from outdoors.  The beds were comfy, the room was clean, and the staff was excellent. The hotel has a fun vibe with interesting design elements.

title: Cool Vibe - needs some work
text: The hotel location was awesome, and the lobbies were well maintained and had a cool vibe to them. The decorative and internal design had an upscale vibe to it and the color scheme was fun. There is a daily resort fee but no real amenities that justifies this fee. They had free coffee in the morning. The design of the room was great, but the functionality not so much. The ceiling fan wobbled and made a clicking sound whenever it was turned on. The air unit in the corner was unbearably loud and every 15-20 minutes would make loud clanking, hissing, and knocking sounds which made sleep miserable.

title: Charming hotel in Soho
text: Very charming hotel in SoHo, room was comfortable and there was no noise at all at night.  Would highly recommend! Friendly staff at the front desk.  There’s a parking lot a few blocks down that the hotel uses, it was a nice trip to the city.

title: Prime location but very mediocre hotel
text:
Friendly welcome at check-in and there was someone who carried the luggage to the room. The location is perfect in a very lively, cool neighborhood with many shops and restaurants and a 2-minute walk from the metro. The size of the room (for 5 people) was ok. In the morning there is coffee and tea ready opposite the checkin, not the tastiest coffee but it is the service that counts. I don't know if I would book it again, price/quality ratio was ok, but the inconveniences such as not being clean and noise pollution are disturbing. The beds were ok.

As a family of 5 (2 adults, 3 children aged 14, 10 and 6), we were allocated room 210. This room is on the first floor behind the reception as there is a Mexican restaurant on the ground floor. The view from room 210 is a messy courtyard with a gigantic air purification plant that runs 24/7 and therefore makes continuous noise. The bathroom had not been cleaned properly as there was still hair in the bath/shower from previous visitors and the TV did not work properly because it froze every time. Went to reception with these complaints and we were assigned the room directly opposite, room 208. This had a great view of the street side, but also the noise from the street and from the noisy Mexican restaurant below, which later in the evening turned into bar/café with loud music until 3am. What was also very annoying, the radiator in room 208 starts whistling 4/5 times a night because it needs to get rid of its air, this is so loud that it wakes you up, especially because it is next to your bed! I reported this to reception but they said there was nothing they could do about it and it was normal. We had no problems with this in room 210. The power of the shower jet is mediocre and the lack of heating in the bathroom is also a downside.

title: Great place to stay!!  Highly recommended!
text: Hotel is beautiful!  Staff was very pleasant. Very quiet and was able to get a terrific nights sleep for a long travel day ahead of us. Highly recommend this hotel!  It fit the area. It fit the entire NYC experience !  So trendy!

title: Wonderful Stay in the Bowery
text: Sohotel is always an easy choice for stays in NYC. Clean and well appointed, close to everything we need to do. It lacks an elevator... but you'll need the exercise after eating at all the great restaurants in the area.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: Great boutique hotel. Close to shopping and several subways. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are nice and clean. No phone in rooms but everyone has a cell phone now. They have discounted parking just a couple blocks away. Would definitely recommend.  Nice and convenient.

title: SoHotel in NOLITA
text:
I have stayed at this hotel several times as the location is very convenient to where my daughter lives in NYC.  The hotel has a lovely and cozy atmosphere and the rooms have a great NYC vibe with an exposed brick wall.  The hotel and rooms are kept very clean and the staff is accommodating.  There is no elevator; however, the staff bring the luggage up the stairs for guests. 
 omplimentary coffee is good quality and made available for guests in the lobby from 6:30 am - 1:30 pm.  The addition of complimentary water for guests would be a great addition and much appreciated.

title: Quick business trip
text: Quick work trip to New York. Location was great. Returned to this hotel after visiting with my family in the summer. If you want a good value hotel that is easily connected to any uptown routes you will not go wrong here

title: Will not be going back.
text: I had high hopes for this hotel, but after one night I knew I’d made a mistake. The radiator in my room made a horrible noise all night long. When I reported it to the hotel staff they said I should’ve booked an upgraded room in the newest part of the hotel… like somehow they knew that my room was awful.  Anyway, lesson learned.  I will not be staying at Sohotel ever again and do not recommend it to friends and colleagues.

title: Sleepless night in Soho
text: This Hotel has a great location, it is decorated very bohemian. We were disappointed with the noise level of the room. The first night there was a constant dripping that was torture and we were unable to sleep. We were changed from that room after the management staff could not remedy the noise. The second room which was next to the first, had the same room but muffled and additional bussing noises. Overall, we were not able to have one night of sleep. In addition, there was a late party two doors down with more people than the room fitted and the fire alarm went off, fire trucks arrived and then loud speakers advising it was a false alarm.

title: Sohotel
text: Easy online check in and check out. Super quiet room despite loud outside. Clean and sheek. No elevator although I knew that going in but helpful to know if you need one. The parking listed online isn't true but plenty of garages nearby

title: A fine place to stay
text: It's reasonably priced and is in a great location (close to Little Italy & Chinatown).  The staff are friendly and approachable.  The hotel has a very nice look/design and it is clearly well kept. I would  use again on a return visit to NYC.

title: Great value
text: A character hotel in a great location. No frills but that suited us. Generous sized rooms and bathrooms and great beds. Friendly service and lots of communal space. We were two adults with two teenagers and we loved it.

title: Convenient location with nice waiting lounge but small dark rooms and not much service
text:
Stayed for 4 nights. The lounge and hotel decor was good and the service staff were friendly. That said, the room was dark with little to no light at any time of the day. It also didn't have the wall paintings that were shown in the online hotel photos.The service fee charged at checkin didn't offer any service to my knowledge including any maintenance or upkeep of rooms etc. The bathroom was very small. Water had to be purchased separately and I didn't find any by the coffee station. 
TL; DR: Good location and ambiance; not very good rooms (the one I stayed at least).

title: Moderno y bien ubicado
text: Habitación correcta, zonas comunes genial, muy acogedor y moderno. En el limite entre China Town, Little Italy y el Soho. Única pega: baño pequeño para una habitación de 5 personas, pero muy bien para moverte en Manhattan y sin mucho ruido exterior

title: Great location! Cozy hotel.
text: We had an amazing stay and were really pleased with the value and coziness of the hotel.  The location was perfect for what we needed, lots of places to eat close by and not too far from the city. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Quick stay during holiday season 2023
text: The experience from booking on their site, to check in, and check out was simple and lovely. The AC units were powerful, but not noisy, the mattress was comfortable, our room had no disturbances that affected our sleep quality, and the shower had good water pressure and temperature control. It was a quick, but lovely stay for both my friend and myself.

title: Perfect location in Manhattan
text: Perfect situated between Financial District and Mid Town with several subwaystations within 5-7 minutes walk. Cosy hotel. Bathroom was outdated. Friendly staff. 314 was a quiet familyroom in the back.

title: Discovering Soho... The architecture of this building is integrated in the rooms and corridors so it was a pleasure
text: The architecture of the building is totally integrated in the rooms and corridors so it was a pleasure to discover each space. The room was very clean and it was pretty new and functional. The staff was friendly and helpful.

title: MD to NYC
text: My young adult aged kids and I were visiting from MD. Sohotel is in a location, near some excellent restaurants, shops and short walk to subway. Room was clean, bed & linens were comfortable. Bathroom was a bit dated but overall this was a great experience. We would definitely re-visit.

title: Historic place with a cool vibe
text: Hip, funky property with interesting design elements. Small rooms but it was a great stay. The location is convenient to Chinatown, SoHo, and the Lower East Side. You can keep a few items in the room,  but you’ll probably have to store your luggage.

title: Attractive, Clean, Cheaper than AirBNB
text: Was looking for a spot to stay while in town for a concert. Airbnb is now less available and more expensive than a hotel. Sohotel was super close, cute, affordable enough - overall happy with this hotel and would stay again!

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text: Extremely friendly & professional staff from check-in to check-out, great location - right next to Chinatown and Little Italy, clean quiet room. Had everything we needed. Beautiful decor - not your standard plain Jane Marriott look that's boring.

title: Okay for a nights stay
text:
This was an okay stay - the room was quite small and had a bright blinking light on the ceiling that was a bit disruptive all night. Otherwise it was generally clean and comfortable enough though.

Mind the bathroom - this was also incredibly small and the way it was set up made it easy to crash into things (e.g. glass shower), especially in the dark

The front door to the hotel locks at 10pm, and unfortunately it doesn't feel like the front desk is watching the doorbell camera to let people in.

title: Location,location,location
text: Bare bones rooms worked for us, comfortable beds,mini fridge and adequate bathrooms. Helpful staff and cute lobby space if your room gets tight. The location could not be beat. If you’re into hip New York this spot is tops

title: No elevator
text: Staff was kind of rude , no space in rooms to turn around , shower flooded most of the bathroom , and NO ELEVATOR . The location was nice but for the price we paid $300 a night after tax it really wasn’t worth it

title: Great stay at Sohotel!
text: We enjoyed our room, the location and overall hotel experience.  The room was a nice size, clean and love the exposed brick.  Beds/bedding were very comfortable as well! Look forward to returning for our next girls weekend!

title: Comfy + Cozy Stay
text: Our room offered comfy and coziness from the moment we walked in. The beds were high quality and the room was very spacious. As a precaution, there is no elevator if you’re staying on the third floor and up - request a lower level if this may be an issue for you and/or your guests.

title: Nice stay
text: Very nice place to stay near China town and Little Italy downtown. The only small thing was no coffee in the room. But they have it downstairs. Beautiful Christmas tree, cool furnishings and quiet sleep,  and comfortable bed.

title: Good location
text:
Good location, very close to one of the coolest neighborhoods in the city, Good sleep quality but no storage space in room ( with 2 beds) for clothes or at least luggages.
Kind staff trying to help whenever you ask them

title: Great location, unique spaces
text: This was a really clean, unique hotel with thoughtful details in each room (heated bathroom floors!). Great location-- walk to shopping, Tenement Museum, Chinatown, great restaurants. Close to several subway lines. They don't seem to have an elevator and there are a lot of stairs, so should be aware if that would be limiting for you.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel, but could use a deeper clean
text: we booked this trip for a Chinatown and Little Italy experience. The location was perfect! Cute, cute boutique hotel, but definitely needs some updates in the rooms. Our air conditioner had so much mold in it that we couldn’t turn it on. Bathroom faucet shower was broken and there was dirt and the bathroom smelled of mold. Overall way too expensive for the quality. They spent a lot of time decorating the lobby and the hotel, which I have to say is absolutely beautiful, but they need to focus more on the cleanliness of the rooms

title: Good stay.
text: Cute rooms with cute decor. Only issue I had was there was no fridge and very noisy if you’re staying on the side that faces the street. Overall I recommend this hotel because of its location. It’s very centralilzed

title: Great service!
text: The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean and hotel had a great lobby area. I forgot my bag in the room and the staff was very helpful in returning it to me in great condition!

title: Awesome find
text: Loved this hotel. It has its own unique style. Loved the fact that floor were not carpet and room was so clean. Also loved the family sized room. Everyone had their own bed and they were comfy. The room was affordably priced as well.

title: Very well polished turd.
text:
Great learning experience. Read the fine print, save your money.

Size of a closet, old underwear on the bedside table, and a shower that floods the entire room.

A shiny exterior wrapped around an old, cramped, dirty crawlspaces they call rooms.

title: Noise was a HUGE issue
text: The hotel itself was cute, great location & staff was wonderful. My BIG issue is Friday & Sat the roof deck across the way was blasting until 3am. It felt like a night club in our room. Zero sleep! 😭

title: Trendy hotel in a perfect location to visit NYC
text: We stayed with our family of 4 adults in the luxury double queen room. According to NY standards the room size was good. We were glad to have a renovated bathroom as even this one was not that recent anymore. Heating in the room made a lot of noise and could only be turned on or off (nothing in between). Good, comfortable beds. Very friendly and helpful staff. Nicely decorated trendy hotel at a perfect location to explore NYC. Only 2 minutes walk to the metro station, China town, little Italy and shopping district.

title: Longer stay in the Sohotel
text: Wonderful stay. Very nice personnel. Very clean rooms. It is right in the corner of Broome and Bowery, so there is always some noice from the streets. I slept really well and for the reason of my trip, the location is excellent. I stayed for ten days and had no issues whatsoever.

title: Great for a family of 5
text: Excellent and extremely affordable place to stay for a family of five. The neighborhood was awesome, too. Our room wasn't a luxury suite, but it was nice enough and had enough places for all of us to sleep – which is hard to come by in NYC.

title: Great Location near Nolita!
text: I stayed at the Sohotel during NYC Marathon Weekend to cheer on my son. It was close to everything, but not congested on Marathon Day.   Several subway stations are very close, and you can walk so many places, include Little Italy (about 2 blocks away) and Washington Square Park. The room was cute with exposed brick, the beds were comfortable and the shower had great water pressure.  There was a nice sitting area on the first floor.  Very convenient public transit access from JFK.

title: Amazing stay!
text: This is a very cool hotel located in a good location in SoHo. The ambience and decor of the hotel is amazing. Comfortable rooms, but be aware they are small rooms without a lot of room to move, as this is a historical building. Modern technology, clean, and painless!

title: Close to everything and super friendly
text: We were close to the subway and great food. We had to travel to different places and it was so easy to do it. The staff was great and beds comfy. Highly recommend it as a place to stay. They didnt have my room ready at 2 v 4 but it was ready by 3 so that was great. I'd also opt for a top floor despite all the stairs- we def had some tap dancing family above us- all hours of the day jumping around and super loud.

title: Great hotel location, crappy wifi
text: If you need wifi, this might not be the place.  I work in tech and am very familiar with all things wifi and all of our devices experienced outages throughout the entire stay.  Had I been on a work trip, I would've needed to stay elsewhere.  Thankfully I just did a mobile hotspot from my phone when the outages occurred. Everything else was fine, clean place, hot water for showering, comfortable beds, great location for Soho.

title: Great location, nice amenities, pricey
text: SoHotel is located in a great area within walking distance of some great restaurants and bars. The subway is close by as well for anything else that would be out of walking range. We got the cheapest room, which was about what we expected, but still very small for the price (which is hard in Manhattan in general). We didn't really make use of the bar downstairs because there was a private event the one night we stopped by. Coffee was available every morning and the staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating.

title: Love this unique and cozy hotel
text:
The hotel is in a great location close to restaurants, shopping and nightlife. The rooms are very NYC cozy but it had everything we needed. Even coffee in the morning downstairs. We loved our stay and will definitely be back.
There is no elevator which wasn’t a big deal for us being on the second floor but something to consider if that’s an issue for you.

title: Upscale Hostel
text: The hotel is located in an area that still has not completely safe. It is riddled with homeless and drug inflicted people. There was always a drunk sitting outside of the hotel. Does not feel safe for a single women staying there. There is no elevator so you have to schlep your bags. No water in the rooms. It can be purchased at a vending machine that only accepts cash. for the amount of money I spent, it is definitely not worth it.

title: Fantastic location, but some things lacking
text: I've stayed at Sohotel a number of times and you can't beat the location. The first few times I stayed here, I was pleasantly surprised by how hip the hotel was, how roomy and comfortable the room was and I loved the private bathroom (a lot of hotels in this price point have strange bathroom set-ups). On this visit however, I was disappointed. My pillows were lumpy, the walls were paper thin, and the offering of tea and coffee in the morning was modest (no sugar!) when in the past it was a lovely spread. I'm not saying I won't stay here again - the location is spectacular - but I do think the hotel needs to step it up a bit.

title: Übernachtung in Soho
text: Wir haben uns das Hotel ausgesucht wegen der Lage,ca.1Std.Fußweg zu the Edge durch schöne Straßen und der High Line.Das Hotel ist sehr stylisch.Das Personal sehr freundlich.Das Hotel hat leider keinen Aufzug,aber mit dem Gepäck wird geholfen.Gut ist auch,dass man das Gepäck nach dem Checkout noch im Hotel lassen kann,um noch bis zur Abreise etwas zu unternehmen.Dieser Service war in diesem Hotel kostenlos.Das gleiche galt auch für den Checkin.Wir waren sehr früh da und konnten die Koffer schon da lassen.

title: Sohotel short stay ✔️
text: Cozy Soho-based hotel, perfect for couples or a business trip. Small, yet stylish and comfortable rooms a short walk to restaurants + bars, Broadway, Fidi, and other attractions. Great staff, very helpful with all inquiries.

title: Horrid
text: There were Drug addicts out front of the hotel night and day and staff does nothing. No parking and no parking discount. Hotel dark and creepy. Room tiny. Staff didn’t want to give us room keys due to laziness.

title: Good Downtown Hotel
text: Pleasant stay. Lovely hotel in great location. My room this time was small and rather dark this time but quiet. I felt safe travelling alone. So many restaurants and two subway stations within close walking distance. Super, helpful staff

title: Excelente ubicación
text: el hotel es bastante cómodo, tiene lo necesario para un viaje de visita a NYC, la ubicación es excelente eso permite que aproveches al máximo tu estadía en la ciudad que nunca duerme, las habitaciones son cómodas, limpias, y el servicio es amable, si quieres que te limpien el cuarto todos los días tienes que avisar.

title: Family trip
text: It was a pleasant experience overall. There was enough space for my family of 5–3 kids, 2 adults. The staff were very helpful, & the hotel was quiet, despite being right by the street. The only complaint is the size of the bathroom, but it’s NYC.

title: Great experience, great location. Elevator... who cares!
text:
I recently stayed at the Sohotel, a beautifully decorated and designed hotel. Even though it lacks an elevator due to its historic building status, the hotel is still a great choice. I was fortunate enough to stay in a junior suite with the most amazing warm tiles in the bathroom. They were perfect for soothing my sore feet after a long day of walking. 

The service I received at this hotel was excellent when I arrived. Although we arrived before the check-in time, we could check in early for an additional fee or store our luggage at the hotel and wait until the official check-in time. We chose the latter option, and when we returned to check in, we were pleasantly surprised to find that the process was speedy and our luggage had already been delivered to our room. Surprisingly, even though the hotel is near a high-traffic avenue, you couldn't hear anything in your room. 

The hotel is near Chinatown, Little Italy, and multiple subway stations.

title: Lack of sleep
text:
Our room had no covers on the quilts. The beds were the put up kind. The air condition unit in room was very noisy and old. The rooms are nothing like the communal funky pictures, no wardrobe a rail on wall so clothes rub against brick work, paint  coming off walls The curtains in the room don’t fit and therefore sunlight comes through onto your face as sun comes up as the top of the bed is directly under.  No yea or coffee in room , no room service unless specifically requested.But our main issue was the broken sleep due to the fire alarms, our first night we were woken in the middle of the night, we were confused and scared , there wasn’t an announcement telling us it was a false alarm so my daughter started to panic. It took far too long for everyone to be told. By this time my daughter and I were unable to get back to sleep so we were tired for our days sightseeing. The next night we were asleep when around midnight the same happened again, we ran into the hall along with other guests again no one seemed to know what to do as we were not being informed, several minutes of confusion took place before we were informed it was another alarm. Why this wasn’t fixed after the first I don’t know? Again my daughter was apprehensive about sleeping and I couldnt get back off worrying about if it should go off again and the lack of direction, again lack of sleep had an adverse effect on our sightseeing. Unbelievably it went off again this morning when all we wanted was to sleep, why this problem wasn’t fixed as an urgent matter the first time is behind me? 
Our holiday stay was severely affected by the issues at  hotel. Charged me even though I’d paid through booking . Com. It seems they do this as a matter of course. £1200 deposit taken again room, after taxes the room was nearly £400 a night ! No reply to emails from hotel,

title: Incredible people and a very cool hotel.
text: Donette, the manager, went above and beyond in helping me with an item I forgot at the hotel.  She was so kind, gracious, and thoughtful in every interaction we had.  All of the staff I spoke with were so nice and welcoming. I was there during fashion week so it was fully booked but it never felt crowded or busy.    I would return to the Sohotel again without question.  I really enjoyed the cool, considered decor and the hotel location can't be beat.

title: unique!
text: What a unique hotel! It was Super cute! And in a Great location! We were close to Chinatown and Little Italy as well as several little breakfast places. It Feels safe but not ridiculously expensive. The Staff was helpful and friendly. We loved the decor too.

title: Bad place in filthy part of the city
text: We have spent two nights in this hotel. Definitely the worst two nights spent in a hotel room in the last 15 years or so. By the way we are visiting NYC 5-6 times/year and are very familiar with the hotels in the city. First, at 350$/night (excluding taxes!) this place is a total rip-off. Second, they don't have an elevator, nor any accommodations of people with disabilities. The rooms are dirty, the beds have hard mattresses and bad-smelling pillows. The bath tub and the shower head were both in a poor condition - we reduced the number of showers taken in that place to minimum just to stay away from the shower. The location is very dirty and with plenty of homeless people around - especially in the evening. At 1 a.m. on Saturday morning we got a street gang of drummers making a ton of noise just under our window - obviously with the intent to wake up the hotel guests. No one from the hotel has done anything about it. We called the police but eventually they left (about 30 min later) before the police arrived at the place. A very very bad experience.

title: 3 days in Soho
text:
Joli hôtel au style tres new yorkais. 
Déco jolie et sympa, chambre pour 4 ( 2 lits queen) confortable pour quelques jours seulement. (Aucun rangement fermé)
Staff très agréable et disponible 
Emplacement tres pratique

title: LOUD HOUSEKEEPING EARLY IN THE MORNING! AMAZING ROOM + BATHROOM.
text:
Would come back again when prices are low just to enjoy the heated tile in the bathroom. Great bathroom design and amenities! Very clean. Room was beautiful and clean with fun extra bits, including a tote bag and Kodak camera for guest use.
TV did not work at night but too late to call maintenance when I discovered the issue, but TV worked in the morning? Very weird.
Room was very quiet and blocked out NYC outdoor noise which was awesome but all this was ruined by the obnoxiously loud housekeeping. At 7:00 AM, we heard doors slamming and literal stomping on the floor above us, which may have been guests? Hotels should enforce quiet hours until a certain time... After about an hour of LOUD stomping of boots or heels above us and constant doors creaking open and slammed closed, I realized it was housekeeping moving around. I tried to sleep-in since we had a late night but from 7:00 AM till 9:30 AM, it was just so loud. I could hear yelling and it was definitely not guests, but workers. So ridiculous! I'm dying to come back to the wonderful hotel but only when the rates are low because the noise is just so loud so early in the morning.
Check-out the next morning was a little hectic. Lobby was packed with people and luggage. I wish the staff directed the traffic better and let people know where to stand and wait to check-out and to store luggage. There were issues with the guests getting help before me - one guest was rude to the staff and acting very entitled, then the next guest had a language barrier issues, so by the time it was my turn to check-out the front desk attendant was clearly overhwhelmed and a little irritated. She quickly recovered and ended up helping with  a smile in the end and got me checked out very quickly. They did not offer to show me by charges on the invoice, but I later found the invoice for my stay in my email inbox. 
10/10 room in the end! Would come back again but only when I know I have to be up early in the mornings. No chance of sleeping in here.

title: Great staff, awesome location!
text: My flaming and I enjoyed our stay very much. We loved the location and it was super close to Little Italy and Chinatown. We were close to good coffee and the subway. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We will be back again!

title: Séjour très agréable, hotel propre et calme, bien situé.
text:
HOTEL très bien situé dans le lower east side, à proximité immédiate de plusieurs bouches de métro et à quelques encablures  à pied de nombreux centres d'intérêt. Batiment historique, vieilles briques 
L'établissement est très propre et calme, le personnel discret mais efficace et serviable. 
Notre chambre, une familiale était spacieuse, suffisamment équipée et dotée d'un réfrigérateur. Literie d'un grand confort, déco soignée et agréable. Boissons fraiches à l'arrivée dans la chambre, boissons chaudes pour le petit déjeuner à disposition chaque matin dans le lobby.
Séjour  de 10 nuits  parfait!

title: Great Location near Little Italy
text: Walking through the hotel is like walking through an art gallery. I was staying with the family and the 3 bed room was very tight for all 5 of us and our luggage. Luckily we didn't need to spend much time there. There are a lot of stairs and no elevator so if you have young ones be ready to be patient or help them. Parking is affordable and a few blocks away. Right by the subway station, Canal street, and Little Italy.

title: Vacation trip with my daughter
text:
Design (industrial type in connection with the historic site), calm and cleanliness of the room which has been renovated with the necessary accessories (USB sockets) to charge your phone without a US plug.
If you are a fashion victim, it's the right place to be ;-)
Kindness and High level of professionalism (car service...).

title: Lovely staff but terrible rooms
text: While I appreciate the location and the helpfulness of your staff, the hotel - roomed especially - are in poor shape. Considering what I paid I wouldn't  return. I've paid less for boutique hotels much much cleaner/brighter.

title: excellent
text: Room was great (if small).  Everything was clean and well-kept.  1st floor lounge area was great, and I wound up working from there one day.  Reasonably quiet, good location.  I found the staff to be friendly and helpful throughout my 5-night stay.

title: Fine establishment
text: I had a WONDERFUL stay at this hotel. It fits right in with the atmosphere. I loved the decorum The staff was super friendly. I read a review that someone was annoyed there was no water in the room. Come on people it's New York! It's not a 3rd world country where you can't drink the water. Don't be so wussy. New York City was voted the best water in the country!

title: Perfect for family and good location.
text: The location is awesome. You can come and go in Chinatown and the proximity to Little Italy is very nice. The metro is very close and the area is relatively quiet and you feel safe.The staff is very welcoming. We were even received in French. We had reserved a very good indoor parking lot 3 blocks away. I think Chinatown and Little Italy are interesting to visit both day and night. So staying in the neighborhood allows both easily and without spending a lot of time there.

title: Just. Don't.
text:
Let me list the reasons you should not consider this hotel.
No elevator in a four-floor building, no coffee maker in your room, coffee in the lobby but only when they decide to refill the pitcher, no trash can near the coffee so the counter is littered with half-full cups, no food at all, the nearest food source is blocks away, freezing AC in the lobby, hot in the hallways on the third floor because there are no doors between floors. Brick interiors so the very loud sound of your neighbor's door closing WILL wake you up. No closet for your clothes, no chair or sofa, the lighting sucks, the toilet flushing WILL wake up your wife, distance from the bed to two walls: 16 inches or so, industrial air conditioners cycling on and off outside our window.

I wouldn't go there again if they paid me. You have been warned.

title: Unclean and thin walls, rowdy neighbors
text: The room was not fully cleaned. there were hair in the bathroom floor and sink. no water/ kettle basic needs provided. super small room and bathroom. The walls are so thin and i could hear people pouncing on the walls at night.

title: Noisy AC window units and non-refurbished bathrooms
text: Front of house spaces and hotel rooms are refurbished, yet small hotel rooms have very noisy old window-AC units. Small bathrooms are not refurbished and 20+ years old, and clearly from last generation of this hotel’s life, outdated, run down and not in keeping with advertised style.

title: Fun Getaway
text: My partner and I had a great time visiting the city. The person who greeted us when we arrived was helpful in recommending things to do, and she helped guide us on public transportation. She was also accommodating to hold our bags for us, as we arrived earlier than our check-in time.

title: Family stay in NYC.
text: Traveling with our family of 5 to Calgary, we decided to stop off in NYC for a few days. Kids are 11, 9 and 6 and therefore we have trouble finding suitable accommodation. Large room with two queen beds and a single was perfect. More than enough and comfortable. Close to a number of subway stations to take you anywhere and a short walk to Soho. We walked to battery park which took about 30 min.

title: Very good stay for the price
text: Very nice hotel tucked between SoHo and Chinatown. Very cute rooms and excellent staff. Room was a little small but that wasn't an issue due to being a solo traveler. Will definitely book again for my next trip!

title: Great management and staff !
text: Unfortunately we were unable to reach the hotel due to flight cancellations, the staff at the hotel were so lovely, they understood our challenge and made our life so much easier with their response.  Definitely on my list to visit when we make it to NY.  Thank you guys

title: Cute Hotel, Perfect for Weekend Trip
text: Staff was so friendly and accommodating for early check-in and holding our bags for a late check-out. Room & bathroom was nice and clean. Beds were comfy. Note that there is no mini fridge in the room. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Friendly staff but not worth the price
text: The rooms were super dingy, the A/C was so loud I could barely sleep. The neighborhood was good. It felt like they hadn’t done a deep clean and fresh coat of paint in the room in a very long time. Wouldn’t recommend.

title: Love it!
text: Wonderful place! Staff is amazing! Have stayed here twice and will stay again should I travel to the city. Location has some good restaurants nearby and close to several metro entrances. Reasonable space for the value, well maintained and CLEAN!

title: Great overall, but no mini-fridge in room.
text: You can check in and out all through the app which was nice, and the room was clean and nice. My room had hard wood floors, which was unique. No microwave or fridge, but I didn't end up having any leftovers anyways. Very friendly staff. Another weird quirk is that noise traveled down the hallway in such a way that every time someone near me opened their door, it sounded just a bit like it was my door that was opening.

title: The Sohotel - the best bohemian hotel I’ve ever stayed in!!!
text: Sohotel’s staff were so nice & friendly!  Our Family room was a good space & super clean & comfy. But I think the best thing about this hotel aside from its central downtown location is its bohemian artsy vibe.  I love the decors!! A unique experience indeed!

title: Phenomenal Stay! 10 out of 10 stars
text: Front desk staff was amazing. Ralph was especially kind and helpful. Helped us with our bags up the stairs. (Please note: no stairs and the reception desk is on the second floor). 10 out of 10 customer service! Our accommodations were comfortable and beautiful. Love the whole atmosphere and vibes of the hotel. The Family (3 bed suite) was perfect for us! Plenty of room and the price was just right. Happy to stay here again for sure!

title: Brilliant
text: Great Staff. Great Location. Perfect room. Great value. BRILLIANT. The staff recommended a terrific restaurant and a cracking coffee shop up the street. Everyone is so helpful. I will definitely stay there again

title: Great hotel
text: Sohotel was perfect. The location is so close to great places in Manhattan. The neighborhood is wonderful. Cute restaurants and bars right by hotel. Nice little sitting areas in the hotel as well. Rooms were clean and updated.

title: Not worth the money
text: location not as indicated, it's not in Soho-  maybe lower East side or China Town. Restaurant closed in hotel which is ironic as hotel sent not advertising food options rooms tiny, dark, no storage, no elevator VERY loud air conditioner. Wouldn't stay here again

title: WORST HOTEL EVER
text:
STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL UNLESS YOU ARE NOT AFRAID OF TRANSMISSIBLE DISEASES FROM INSECTS AND PARASSITES!!!!
THIS HOTEL IS THE WORST I EVER STAYED AT!! I ever stayed at! Dirty, unfriendly and rude people!
I checked in at 1.00 am, went to my room and, the moment i put my key on the desk a huge cockroach walked under my suitcase and under the bed. I went to the reception in panic, the front desk man came, killed the cockroach and was getting ready to leave. i told him i did not want to stay in that room. he put me in another room for one night only, for the following night he had no availability. I slept dressed, had horrible nightmares about insects. the following morning I had to look for a last minute hotel which cost me a fortune. I asked the hotel to credit me the terrible night i had to spend and, after countless phone calls and emails, the hotel management refused and suggested that i may contact them for a future stay!!

title: Clean and Nice
text: The Sohotel is friendly, clean and nice. Simple and just right size room (standard queen) for me. Appreciate that the windows open to let in fresh air. Staff was friendly and efficient. Location was convenient to everything - nice to be in a neighborhood with cafes and shops right there. Great price too. Would return.

title: Noisy and basic for price value
text:
We booked into a standard room and the air- conditioning and mouse of other rooms ruïned the night. Upgraded room was nice.
No help from staff, they watch you struggle bringing up the stairs your luggage.
Un polite man at reception at check in.
One woman staff member was very friendly offering paid upgrade after sleepless night.

title: Great stay, great location -highly recommend!
text: My daughter and I had a quick NYC trip planned and LOVED our stay at the SoHotel -staff, upgraded room and their courtesy morning coffee was excellent, 10/10.  The move to the upgraded room was totally worth the extra cost, and though it's hard to go up and down the stairs multiple times (there's no elevator, it's a historic building), I was completely charmed at the end and I appreciated the bit of cardio I got ;-) Really great experience and look forward to coming back with friends.

title: Good location, no elevator, no breakfast
text:
1) first time I hear that check-in time is as of 4pm and that if you want to check-in earlier there is a charge of 60$ (I think for each anticipated hour). We arrived at 2:50pm and after a bit of conversation the concierge let us in without paying…
2) checkout is by 11am but if you go out to get breakfast (as they only have coffee available) and it’s 10am you can’t get back in the room as your card key has been already deactivated!! Isn’t 1100 check out time?
3) it does say in their website that there is no elevator but usually you don’t go through the entire website especially if you don’t have time. 
So why don’t they just make a nice window in their modern website to inform upfront and well visible to potential guests that there is no elevator. 
4) the room is nice, the bathroom also. The bed is made with linen and a duvet as a cover with no bedsheet…so this is not the best in terms of hygiene especially because lots of people love to put their luggage on the bed! And is not that you can change a duvet every time there is a new guest. I have then asked for a sheet to put over the duvet !!
5) location is good
6) they say in the website food and beverage available but if they refer to the restaurants connected to their building they are not open at all times, unless I have missed something in the hotel, beside coffee in the morning.

title: Soho stay
text: Great location for easy access to a a fun and vibrant part of town. Appreciated the easy access to various train lines. Plenty of watering spots and good food to be found within a few minutes from the hotel. Plus the rooms have the charm of « industrial loft », beware its a very old building with no elevators!

title: Lose the DNA
text: It was disgusting having the residue of the prior guest(s?) all over the place. It was further disturbing when the hotel staff did not seem to take us seriously. I'm not inclined to visit the hotel again as the whole experience was very disturbing.

title: Nice boutique hôtel vreat location
text:
Very nice deco for this boutique
Friendlyness of the staff and warmly welcome
Hotel ideally located between soho little Italy and chinatown
Many restaurants bar and salons de thé for all budget and tastes
Many subway around to go everywhere in Manhattan

title: Sohotel
text: Patio terrace was not open. Restaurants attached only open on certain nights. Small rooms. Needs more lighting. Great location. Friendly staff. Charged more than suggested on Agoda $1933 to $2033 + resort fees which I was aware of.

title: small rooms
text: The staff was wonderful and helpful and very accommodating. The issue we had is that there is so little floor space in the room to layout our luggage and there was no space to store any clothing other than some hangers. Four adults in one room with so little space just was very difficult and I can’t recommend it for that reason. If there is no furniture provided to store our clothing then there should at least be a reasonable amount of space to store our luggage so that it is accessible to live out of. We had to use floors for two of the luggage and counter tops for the other two. This created a situation where we had to avoid falling over luggage and absolutely no remaining space for other things. Also, the shower is half open (a plate of glass covers half and the other half is open and without a shower curtain) so the water sprays and starts to run out. There was a rolled up towel at the shower entrance to prevent water coming out, but it just made for a daily wet towel mess in the bathroom.

title: Generational Trip
text: The uniqueness of the decor is quite appealing and lends to a true NYC vibe. Accommodating staff both front desk and room services make for a pleasant, comfortable stay. Great location for all Soho restaurants and shopping.

title: Would recommend
text: Helpful and friendly staff.  Beautiful bathroom with excellent shower.  Tight quarters with thoughtful use of the space available.  Easy to walk to variety of restaurants and shops.  Convenient enough to subway.

title: Kann man machen...
text: Alles ok, leider werden die Kosten bei der Buchung nicht vollständig angegeben. Es kommen noch 19,99$ pro Nacht als Service auf die Rechnung und die übliche New York Stadt & Staat Steuer. Der fehlende Fahrstuhl kann am Ende eines langen New York Tag schon nerven. Die Kollegen sind sehr freundlich. Die Zimmer sind sauber, bieten aber nicht sehr viel Platz für Koffer und es gibt keine "richtigen" Schränke um seine Sachen staubgeschütz abzulegen. Die Lage ist dafür sehr gut. Frühstück oder Abend-Cocktail ist alles fussläufig erreichbar. Die Metro liegt zwischen 200-400m entfernt.

title: Perfecto para una familia. Original y excelente ubicación
text: Fuimos una familia con 3 hijos adolescentes. La family room es perfecta para una familia, tiene 2 camas matrimonio amplias (aprox 2 m) y una cama individual (aprox 150), ya que había tanto que hacer y ver en NYC que estuvimos poco tiempo en la habitación. Inconveniente no hay armario (solo 1 barra) ni cajones (solo 2-3 baldas) así que está bien pero para pocos días de estancia.Hotel muy céntrico, sugiero pedir habitación interior. El personal es muy amable. El hotel está muy limpio. La decoración muy original. La recepción está en el primer piso y no hay ascensor así que hay que cargar con las maletas.

title: Tiny and hot
text: Smallest room, I couldn't walk past the bed without turning sideways and squeezing past and I only weigh 120lbs. Extremely hot room with no way to cool down as even the fan didn't counter how hot it was. Plus side was location as close to great shops and restaurants but walked out on the first morning to a massive dead rat which took the shine off as well (although not really hotels fault!)

title: Jewel of a hotel!
text: We LOVED the Sohotel!  The location is perfect, within easy walking place to Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho, etc.  It was also close to a subway station for access to other areas.  Although our room was small, it was charming and extremely comfortable.  The bed was super comfortable and our room was extremely quiet.  The decor is fun and added to our enjoyment of a real New York experience!    All staff were very helpful and friendly.  We highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for comfort value, good location, and a property that has personality!

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text: Loved our second stay at the Sohotel. The location is superb, close to excellent food, plenty of subway stops, and far enough away from but an easy ride to broadway shows. The rooms with 3 beds are an amazing benefit for our family.

title: Ideal location, size, value
text:
We took our three boys to NYC for the first time, and Sohotel was the perfect experience. We have two teenagers and a total of 5 people, so sleeping accomodations are always a challenge. Our room had 3 beds which allowed for everyone to sleep comfortably – which was huge. 
The neighborhood around the hotel is also incredible – giving us the ability to experience lots of different cuisine and culture within a short walk. It's also convenient to the subway system, so we could easily get around the city.

title: SO LOUD!
text: Everything about the hotel is great - location, price, room size {family room with 2 teens was a great size and worked well}, Piacere downstairs delicious food!!  My rating is because the noise inside {guests banging on doors and yelling at 3am for long periods of time} and outside was so loud!  Mid week nights were not as bad as Fri/Sat nights with the club under the hotel that you can feel/hear the music from 12-4am. We were on the second floor - may not be as noticeable on higher floors.

title: Girls Trip
text: Hotel exceeded our expectations!  Loved the whole atmosphere and cleanliness of the hotel.  We especially enjoyed hanging out in the downstairs lobby in between our outings.  We will definitely return on our next visit to NYC!

title: Great Location & Interior
text: This is a great location and the decoration is very cool. I've stayed in this hotel before but we were disturbed during the night for the first time by dogs barking and doors slamming outside our room. Aside from that we had a very positive experience.

title: Nice historic hotel in a great location
text: Important to know there is no elevator in this building so request a lower floor if you have a lot of luggage or don't select if lots of steps are an issue. The resort fee is high and we didn't receive water which was supposed to be included. There was a lot of street noise at night which kept us up. The room lighting is terrible. Need a lamp. That said, it's a lovely historic property, the location is perfect for West Village, Soho, Greenwich Village shopping and restaurants. This is our 2nd stay and I would stay again based on location and walking convenience.

title: Cute Arty Hotel: 2 star European type
text:
Nice little arty hotel on the edge of Chinatown and little Italy.  I heeded others' advice and requested a room on the 2nd floor which you will definitely want to do because nobody wants to walk up 4 flights of stairs end of the day.  Even as a solo traveler, the king room was concise and the bathroom tiny.  But the shower was fantastic. For some reason there was no decent lighting in the room I was in - it's all romantic lighting. You look great, but I couldn't put on make up in the room because I couldn't see myself effectively. That was pretty weird. My room needed a lamp!  During a rainstorm the TV reception fell apart and didn't work. It was a very European 2 star hotel experience. 

Housekeeping is request only. Coffee and tea service in lobby seems set up by someone who isn't a fan of either. No cream for coffee, no non-sugar sweetener. There are some vending machines and an ice machine. Heat, AC, fridge all worked fine. Liked that you could open the windows a bit. Whole place smelled great.

It was an ok stay, but I don't think I'll return. Was hoping for something more solidly 3 star +.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: We love this neighborhood and wanted to try a new property.  This one looked quirky, historic and interesting. The rooms were also intended for up to four people, which was a bonus for a New York hotel!  We didn't eat on site, but the coffee in the morning was very good.  The staff made the difference, though.  They were extremely courteous and helpful.  It had the feeling of a smaller hotel, due to the kind and accommodating nature of the staff.

title: Ignacio
text: The location is very Good. The rooms were really small, so it was uncomfortable to call foo cleaning with the bags and space. The service of people working there were excelente with us, very helpful!!

title: Gorgeous Hotel with Excellent service
text: Beautiful place to stay, close to everything and the staff was awesome. If you need a late checkout, they were very accommodating and could store your luggage at the hotel while you shop. The ambiance very nice, well-maintained facility, worth every penny!!

title: NICE POSITION BUT BAD AMENETIES
text:
The staff is kind, the hotel is well located but the rooms are so small with no comfort (no wardrobe or shelves to put our clothes) and most of all it's very very noisy. You can hear the people of the next room talking or snoozing as if they are in your own bedroom. We were there for business and need some quiet but impossible...We heard the music from the lobby. The staff told us that they could'nt do anything as it's automatic to shut down the sound level and music...It shut down at midnight not before... And cherry on the cake, a group of teenagers was staying there and shout and slap the doors every evening and night...
The staff is unable to be a bit strict on the quietness... I would have loved to say I will come back to Sohotel but I won't.

title: Relaxing, warm, great value
text: Sohotel's location is ideal, within easy walking distance of anything in lower Manhattan. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the entire place was super clean, and there is definitely a comforting/warm vibe in general. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Pretty Good
text: Stayed there overnight for a business trip. The hotel was very close to the subway so I could just jump onto it to get from the airport and back. The staff was nice. And I slept like a baby in my bed.

title: Great Christmas Gift something to do with family and friends unique experience definitely do it again very chick cool so
text: Very cool experience unique definitely do it again great staff place to visit with family and friends must do in bucket list very accommodating the place is unique and original the staff is friendly and accommodating

title: December stay
text: Hotel was very clean. Beds are very comfortable and well kept. Bathroom tile felt heated. Great location for walking. Great food and iconic staples within a mile of every direction! Staff was very friendly and beyond helpful! Highly recommend! Please note that there are no elevators at this location.

title: First Family Trip to NYC!
text: We loved the look and location of this hotel so we decided to stay here instead of paying a premium for name-brand hotels closer to Time Square. The room was nice, a little cramped for 5 (2 adults, kids 13, 11, and 8) of us but having 3 beds was perfect and out location to the welcome area made getting coffee in the morning feel like a stroll to the living room. The atmosphere inside is great and it truly feels like a home versus a hotel. There are plenty of subway stations nearby and tons of food options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner all within a short walk. We didn't find out until we left that this hotel is the oldest running hotel in NYC which we thought was a pretty cool piece of history to stay and be apart of.

title: Decent but could have found better for the price
text: The lobby was beautifully decorated and smelled great which was promising when we arrived. Sadly the room was not as expected. Very small room but the bed is very confortable. No room to leave the luggage so we were a bit cramped. The bathroom was the big issue for me. Very small with no space to leave any toiletry. We were crammed when trying to get ready. And the paint was falling a bit from the wall due to humidity. The walls were also paper thin. First night we had the music from what I assume was a club downstairs keeping us awake for a while and the last night we heard the couple next door very clearly in the middle of the night. So we might try to find another option next time. But staff was very nice, coffee in the morning also and again, nicely decorated,

title: An Turkish man in NY
text:
Very good location and friendly staff. The room is small but enough for 1 persons stay. You need to book bigger room for couples. 
The location is great since many nice Italian and Chinese restaurant are close by. Great for shopping many nice shops within 5 to 10 minute walk.

title: Really great hotel
text: We loved this hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are large by NYC standards and very clean. We had a room with 2 queens, exposed brick, and heated bathroom floors. Loved the shelving in the room too where we could put our luggage and other items so they didn't have to be on the floor. It was a bit off the beaten path from what we were doing in the City, but the value was worth it.

title: Weekend wedding
text: Hotel was recommended because of its proximity to Capitale. That part was great, but the overall hotel was quite expensive for what it is. I stay in NYC frequently and this room was SMALL. The interior is also in need of repair as we had 3 different colors of faux wood laminate flooring in our room. Bed was fine and staff was pleasant, but would not spend $350/night again.

title: Buyer beware
text:
We stayed one night for a local wedding.
Booked in advance for a queen bed room.
This is a small very old hotel with no elevator and the reception desk is located on the second floor. Our room was on the third floor. The room was so tiny that we had to sit in the lobby since there was no space in the room. There was a bar to hang clothes instead of a closet. The lighting was terrible both in the room and in the bathroom. No phone in the room to contact the front desk to speak to anyone about the major problem, which was the size of the bed. It was a full/double bed NOT a queen. We spoke to them twice before leaving for the evening and got the run around. They said they do not have any doubles only queens and kings but there were no available rooms to switch.
They said they would send housekeeping to check (in the morning). We measured the bed and showed the manager - Donelle- a picture of me laying on the bed with my shins hanging over the edge and I am 5'1". My husband is 6'2" so it was a very uncomfortable night. Donelle said that the mattress supplier was at fault during the pandemic for the size. She said they would be correcting this in the future. The truth is that a queen bed will not fit in the room. The length will not allow passage around the end of the bed. It is barely passable now with under 2 feet. In the meantime the website has only queen and king beds listed as options. Buyer beware. They charge queen size prices for a full size bed.
So we highly recommend that you do not book at this hotel based on the deceit and the discomfort.

title: 5 nights in NY
text: Room very clean but very small for 5 people. Location was ok, but not in the city center (there is a metro station very close but the line is not the best one). The price was very competitive. They don’t clean the room if you don’t ask for it, but if you request it there is not problem.

title: No lift. No kettle. No phone.
text: Long story short it’s a very trendy hotel. But is lacking in a few basics… we have a 2 year old and requested a crib/cot in the room but at no point did anyone highlight there is no lift/elevator. We were on the top floor and it was a mission every day carrying the pram up and down especially if he’s sleeping in it. The room was very cool but no kettle, no phone… it was just super basic/trendy.

title: Great value on the Bowery
text: I love this little hotel.  No frills but super clean and safe and friendly.  Great location.  Perfect for a solo traveler. Close to subway and great downtown bars and restaurants. this is a great option for a hotel in NYC

title: Una gran experiencia!
text:
Sohotel es una instalación histórica, muy bien situada en Manhattan para nuestro gusto. Cuenta con unas habitaciones muy prácticas y confortables, muy bien acondicionadas y con muy buen servicio.
Por todo ello os recomiendo una experiencia en Sohotel.

title: Très accueillant pour les familles.
text:
Les plus : 
super déco
Grandes chambres familiales de bonne taille. 
Accueil chaleureux. 
Très bien situé. 
Literie confortable
Les moins: 
La mauvaise insonorisation entres les chambres et surtout avec l’extérieur. 
Bruyant les vendredi et samedi soirs car au cœur de la vie nocturne.

title: 1st class service and great location.
text: Very large and comfortable beds. Stayed as a family of 4. Service was 1st rate and staff very friendly. Free tea & coffee in the lounge was a nice touch.  Broome street , Grand Street and the rest of NoLita and SoHo are great for food & drink. Spring Street has great fashion stores, but don't expect them to open before 11am.

title: First Stay in NY
text: Whilst this hotel is ideally located for exploring NY, I could not recommend it on 3 counts: 1. We were allocated room 313 which was the noisiest room ever experienced in our 30+ yrs of international travel. This is on the front of the hotel and with the very poor sound insulation feels like you are sleeping on the sidewalk. I now understand the addage of 'New York never sleeps' as with car and trucks using their horns 24/7 and peoplle constantly on the move outside, you don't either! 2. The complete lack of tea / coffee facilities in your room. 3. With only sufficient hanging space for 5 clothes hangers and no drawers, you do literally end up living out of a suitcase.

title: Tiny rooms, high prices, strange charge to cover extras
text: The room was tiny, but the rate was very high.  No elevator.  No offer to help with bags.  Door was very hard to open and close.  We were charged an additional $250 on check in to cover "extras" which apparently will be refunded.

title: Family trip to NYC
text: The Sohotel was a great fit for our needs - one room for a family of 5 for 3 nights. The location is perfect - lots of great restaurants, cafes and shops - plus proximity to a number of different subway stations. Staff was super friendly and helpful and I would definitely recommend to friends going on a short trip.

title: Quick city experience
text:
We stayed for 3 nights enjoyed the un endless amount of activities and restaurants around the city. 
If you stay here you have to understand is a historic hotel with no elevator and few amenities you gotta embrace the charm of the hotel by itself. Rooms are nice but with not much ventilation so that freshness feeling won’t be there. Staff was friendly and proactive. It’s a very convenient place if you are planning to be more outside on the city and not planning to be much at the hotel.

title: Great for families
text: The hotel is in a great location. It is walking distance to many attractions and restaurants. We had a room for five something difficult to find elsewhere and good value. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

title: Standard room
text: Stars queen had, no drawers, no closet, no iron. Lack of snack food available in the neighborhood. Hotel vending machine had candy and chips, cash only. Restaurant in building open Thursday-Sunday evenings only. Awesome I interior vibe.  Prices are different than website. Same standard queen was advertised $185.00 per night.  Pay at hotel was over 400.00 per night.

title: Groovy hotel.
text:
Really nice, clean hotel on the edge of a cool district. Walking distance to the metro subway, Soho, Bowery, Chinatown and Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges. There’s a CityBike terminal nearby too. 
We had a queen room and it was great. Clean bathroom and cable tv with plenty of channels (movies are there). The staff (Frank and Denette) were soooo helpful when we got soaked in the rain, and a couple of other things. Restaurants close as well.

title: Tophotel in Soho
text:
Little nice hotel in downtown Soho.
Nice shops and restaurants in the neigbourhood.  Very good location. 
Very nice staff.  The rooms are a bit used, but clean. Fair enough for one of the oldest hotels in Manhattan Thank you Folks!

title: Lumpy pillows and no AC = no sleep
text: We were there for 5 nights and the hotel was hot and the rooms not serviced. The pillows were old and lumpy and when I asked for new ones they said they did not have any. The air conditioner was so loud we could not sleep. Then we turned it off and it was dooo hot we could not sleep. No service!

title: Good rooms, nice prices perfect location
text: Nice hotel close to little Italy & China and Soho. Subway on walking distance. Restaurants nearby. Rooms are clean, beds are good and staff is very friendly en helpful. Roomrates are friendly compared to other hotels.

title: Lovely people, room dissapointing
text:
Reception were the sweetest and most helpful people I’ve ever experienced! The issue we had was only with our room which felt dirty, stained yellow shower tray, cracked bathroom floor, toilet that didn’t drain properly and bed sheets that didn’t cover the duvet fully which in a hotel is a bit unnerving. 

Location is amazing so would recommend for this and the lovely people, just wish we didn’t pay almost 2 grand for the room we got.

title: Highly recommend
text: No complaints. Staff friendly and helpful especially Robert. Had a family suite with 2 queens and a twin. Traveling with my adult children and spouses.  Plenty of space for our clothes as we were there prior to a family wedding. Beds very comfortable. Great location.  Close to subway and very walkable with many restaurants and boutique stores. Great price!

title: Gem of a boutique hotel found in SoHo
text: Enjoyed the SoHotel for many reasons....great room (had 3 beds for 3 adult females traveling together), clean, unique, had working AC, great location to subway stations we needed and of course, the great staff - very helpful and kind.   Happy to have found this place.

title: Auberge avec style particulier
text:
Chambre très petite mais confortable. 
Chaleureux, tranquille et bien insonorisée. Propre.
J’y retournerai sûrement à ma prochaine escapade à New York.
Le seul bémol est que le restaurant de l’auberge était fermé.

title: Above and Beyond Service - D’Anette
text: We arrived off of a red eye on Saturday morning.  The people at the hotel were very accommodating to get us into a room as soon as possible, even giving us a free upgrade so we could get some rest.  We were also bringing our daughter to college and they helped us coordinate a cost-effective car service to get us there with all of her stuff and on time.  I cannot say enough about how kind they were, especially D’Anette!  She was so patient and nice to everyone I saw her encounter on a very busy day.  The hotel itself is beautifully decorated keeping the history of the building and hike bringing in modern comforts.

title: Comodo
text: Struttura recentemente rinnovata. Personale estremamente gentile e cortese. Camera 404 spaziosa, con doccia larga e funzionale. Benché si affacciasse sulla strada non l'ho trovata rumorosa. Si va a piedi a ground zero e ad altri posti di interesse.

title: Small hotel with nice location and very nice staff
text: We booked the hotel for its location and we weren’t disappointed. It’s very close to Little Italy which has hinders of good Italian Restaurants. However, Hotel is dingy with rooms a little cramped. However, our room with 3 beds for 5 guests was adequate.

title: A tiny life experience
text:
We booked this hotel because we like the area and it looked charming on the pictures. Also prices of the rooms were reasonable.  It is indeed a charming building with the brick stone walls and pillars and the old wooden floors with rugs on it. So far so good. Then the rooms. We have stayed in many NYC hotels and we know the rooms are usually small. The standard queen room in the Sohotel is no exception. The size of the room is the size of the queens bed plus about 2 feet at each side of the bed and perhaps  2.5 ft at the foot end. The surprise was the bathroom. The bathroom itself was very tiny, the shower in it the smallest I have ever seen. The recess with the toilet would have made a nice towel cupboard but was even for us, “not so big” people, tight. But everything worked notwithstanding it was all a bit outdated. 
The room had a well working ac unit almost on the floor at the foot end of the bed so I needed to keep my feet covered. Also there was a tv. No unnecessary extra’s. 
All in all it was not bad but for us it has nothing to come back for. For those who do want to try a queen room in the Sohotel we recommend that you book a room for three people. They are about the same price and at have a slightly bigger bathroom (shower in bathtub) and some space to move around.

title: Perfect location & very serviceminded
text:
Love this hotel, been here several times for more then 10 years
Location is Perfect, many subway-Lines to choose from, if you cant Walk where ur heading
Many bars/restaurants just outside the door of the hotel, small stores, deli’s for bagel-breakfast. Just have to love this area

title: Très bon hôtel au cœur de NOLITA
text: Très agréable dans un quartier très vivant et à deux pas de chinatown et de soho , Greenwich village … déco super , un des rares hôtels avec des chambres à 3 lits pour 5, mais les standards sont un peu petites , seul défaut .

title: Comfortable and perfect location
text: Just two corners away from Little Italy, and right in Chinatown, so plenty of places to dinner. The hotel is cozy and very comfortable but the rooms are a little small (I know, all rooms in Manhattan are tiny). The hotel has no elevator but the staff is very friendly and helps you with your baggage.

title: Would have been a 5 star
text:
The hotel is great. Love the styling and for us it had a big family room that could sleep all four of us together, important with two kids who can’t have a room to themselves. Staff were very helpful.

The only thing that let this hotel down is that they put a bachelor party in the room next door to a jet lagged family from the UK on the first night. Not clever and it meant our trip was spent more tired than it should have been. Such a shame.

title: Our Room Flooded from Above
text: We woke up at 1:30 in the morning to a stream of water flowing down from the ceiling and soaking the bed we were sleeping in. We had to pack up all of our things, wake up our son and move in the middle of the night to another room. The hotel didn't seem to care and begrudgingly offered us 20% off of our stay for only that night. Accidents happen but given that we were never able to get a full night's sleep [which is really what you are paying for] they should have not charged us for that night [we stayed multiple nights]. We are not picky guests. There were many things wrong with our initial room that we chalked up to staying in a more boutique hotel, but given that the water was most likely from an overflowing toilet above us, and the hotel's complete lack of caring, we can not recommend staying here. Additionally, there seemed to be an absence of security [front door was never locked at night] and my wife, who travles often for work, said she would not feel confident staying here on her own.

title: Not the best
text: Unfortunately we were charged additional monies not advertised before arrival. Hotel staff also mentioned we had to upgrade our room at $50/night additional as ours was not ready. Great location but the staff experience and being mis-led then charged more is a deal-breaker for me to recommend anyone stay here.

title: Simply perfect
text: Really cool hotel, perfect with teenagers/young adults, excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, best price-quality value in Soho! Bedding was confortable, very nice shower. Quiet at night even on the weekend ;-)

title: A Lovely Hotel in SoHo!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the SoHotel - we were only in town for a short time, but it was exactly what we needed. It also was much more reasonably priced than a lot of other boutique-style hotels in the area!

title: 3 beds in a room
text: Sohotel is a find because they have rooms with 3 beds (2 double, 1 twin).  What is lost is a functional bathroom.  A doorway so small you can barely walk through, shower that gets ever l thing  wet.  Hotel was very clean except for bathroom fan.   Location near Chinatown, little Italy!is great.

title: Great location. Good value.
text: Enjoyed this hotel in the Bowery. Close to all. Soho. Lower east side. Little Italy. There are tons  of restaurants in the area. I’ve stayed three times already because I love the location and the staff is very helpful and friendly. It has a cool vibe in the lobby and good morning coffee. I plan to come back and again!

title: Good location
text:
Nice hotel with excellent location. Located just between Little Italy and China Town. Perfect for exploring Manhattan.
Nice clean room with a cool decor.  
AC was so very loud so we didn’t sleep so good.

title: Super nice location near little italy, noisy aircon and small room. Close connections.
text: Nice hotel in Soho/ Little Italy. Close to connections and good walking distance. Super nice neighborhood with shopping and many restaurants near by. Small room, aircon was super noisy - slept with earbuds. Also difficult to tune the aircon, either cold as he... or nausea.

title: Best location in NYC
text: Hotel perfectly situated in Soho next to chinatown and little italy. Room was big by NYC standards and clean. Would appreciate coffee in room rather than in the reception mornings. Will come back here later!

title: Great boutique location
text: Great location, right across Soho, China Town and Little Italy.  Train stop direct from Jamaica Station - JFK.  Little boutique hotel. Friendly staff and very helpful.  My room was small, but cozy.  Extra clean.

title: Gr 8 Grad getaway
text: The street noise is pretty loud, but we consider it part of the NY experience. The air conditioner helps block it out. This was my fourth visit to the SoHotel and I will be back. Great walkability to little Italy, Soho, Brooklyn bridge etc etc, super close to subway, overall exactly what I look for in a visit to NY. The staff are super nice, helpful, will hold your baggage before and after checkout, absolutely no complaints. Thanks for another great weekend in the best city!!

title: Great location. Clean. Good service. Family room is unique.
