text: Great location. Close to many nice restaurants, (coffee) bars and boutiques. Several subway stations nearby to explore the city. We fit well in the family room with 2 older kids (17-19), not too big but already quite unique for Manhattan. The hotel interior has a wonderful industrial style, clean, good service. Airco in the room is working but not as good as in the public areas. No lift so you must be able to climb the stairs to the 2nd floor for this family room.

title: Lovely building & location, but -  you'll be up all night.
text: You'll hear your neighbors coughing, the baggage being dragged down the halls. Doors opening, shutting - unless you have the window unit on max - and then you are in a wind tunnel. Would not recommend for anyone who needs to sleep. Also the bathrooms...peeling paint, a step up to get to the toilet/shower (yikes - in the middle of the night - ouch!). Smells damp everywhere.

title: Clean but quirky hotel with lots of character.
text: Charming hotel with lots of character. Excellent location near both Chinatown and Little Italy. Hotel is immaculate. Very comfortable beds and friendly, helpful staff. The only drawback is that there is no elevator. You have to climb a flight to reception and even higher to the rooms. For 2 older adults, that was a challenge.

title: Soho, best place to start in New York
text:
Nice hotel, close to the subway. Very friendly und helpfull staff.
No breakfast at the hotel but close to little italy with a lot of cafes and restaurants. Would go there again. Stayed with my family for 4 days.

title: Great location and the interior looks great, the rest is below average
text: We stayed here for a week. I was drawn to this hotel because of the location and the great pictures. The location is great, in walking distance from nice restaurants and shops in Little Italy, Soho and Chinatown. The room and the lobby look great, but unfortunately that's where the comparison with the photos on the website ends. The bathroom was very, very basic. But what surprised me the most was that the hotel does not clean the rooms anymore because of covid restrictions (???). The rooms are cleaned upon request only. I got the feeling that they were a bit understaffed and that covid was used as an excuse.

title: Cute hotel, great staff, amazing location
text: The staff was very helpful, the design was fun and unique, the location to shops/stores was fantastic. Only thing was the lighting was minimal so it was hard to do our makeup but it wasn't a huge deal. Overall, would stay here again!

title: Watch your step!!
text: No elevator here and a steep flight of steps that my husband fell down. Rooms are tiny to average…if you book make sure you don’t do the single queen bed. SUPER TINY!  Good location if you’re into the touristy Little Italy just a few blocks away.

title: Overlooked gem
text: The attention to detail and courtesy of the staff was exceptional. The room was charming. Lots of unique architectural touches throughout the common areas of the hotel. Loved the rainfall shower. Just like a spa!

title: Would never stay here again
text:
This was an awful experience.  One of our beds was under a leak in the ceiling, dripping water onto my son during the night. He slept horribly.  Also, there is virtually no security - the front desk was frequently unmanned, with nobody watching who is coming and going. Anyone could have come in off the street.
   They moved us out of our room with leak (good news) but the new room did not have a chain lock on the door (bad news).  
  Also, loud music on Friday night from the bar downstairs.
 This hotel has nothing going for it - don't see why anyone would stay here.
  When we complained about the cost of the room with leaky ceiling on checkout, we were given 30% off -- with the logic that since our room had 3 beds and only one bed had a leak over it, then we should just get that one-third off the price.  They kept asking why didn't call during the night. There are no phones in the rooms!
   Not customer-centered at all!  We did not feel like our customer experience or satisfaction was a priority.

title: Centrally located but misleading pictures and lack of service for that price
text: Centrally located. However the pictures create a wrong expectation: the rooms any the bathroom was really small any did not resemble the pictures at all (we were not the only ones to complain). There was no room service only upon request and several reminders. So I would not go there again.

title: Quite & safe
text: Enjoyed my stay at Sohotel. The staff was great, the room was super clean and comfortable AND quiet! I definitely recommend. There isn't an elevator, so be prepared for the stairs. The staff was more than helpful taking my bag up to the room. There are several levels of lounge areas, which made the space feel more private.

title: Great stay
text: We had a great stay. Big rooms, clean and nicely decorated. The doors are a bit thin so you’ll hear people coming and going. Typically for NY the water pressure is ridiculous low and AC a bit noisy. Very friendly staff! Would definitely come back!

title: Room 216
text:
We have stayed at Sohotel previously & the room was okay, but we never thought it could get worst than the previous! The room we stayed in this time smelled like trash, it was small for a two bedroom which we understood because it’s NY, walls/floors were thin & we could hear stomping above us & in the room behind her headboard & the view was of roofs which made it dark & dreary.
I almost felt like we were being punished — that couldn’t have been the only room that was left with 2 beds!?
The man who checked us in was nice enough & we were escorted by a gentleman to our room but the woman who checked me out the next day ignored me entirely as I was standing by the desk.

title: Great stay at great location
text:
Had a great stay with my family (2 adults + 3 kids).
Loved the interior and the location was fantastic. Bowery is a busy street but it didn’t bother us at all when in the room. The great thing was to get off the subway at prince or spring street and pass/stop at all the great small shops and restaurants in the areas on the way back from sightseeing every day.

title: Birthday weekend in NYC
text: This hotel is absolutely lovely. A special shoutout to Donnet at the front desk. She is truly awesome. Her recommendations and genuine kindness made us feel very special throughout our weekend stay!! The entire staff was friendly and helpful with any request/questions we had. Our room was beautiful and SPOTLESS! The location was perfect for us. Just a few steps from fabulous restaurants, shops, Little Italy, etc. We were also able to easily and safely walk to SoHO and Washington Square Park and had easy access to the subway for trips further uptown. We will definitely return to Sohotel!! Great experience.

title: Great location - close to subway
text: We stayed at this location as so was running a 1/2 marathon in Brooklyn . We loved this hotel and will stay here again . Quiet room , super friendly staff .  We had dinner booked in this part of New York so we walked everywhere .

title: Visit to our daughter at NYU
text: I’ve researched all hotels in NYC. This one was the best we’ve stayed at so far. Lots of character and large room which is hard to find in the city. Loved the history and location. Wonderful windows that opened and fantastic quality bed.

title: Historic Hotel
text: The huge drawback for many guest will be the lack of elevator. However the hotel has some great features. It's a Fantastic home base. 3 subway lines within easy walking distance. Chinatown/Little Italy are at your doorstep. Katz deli, Russ and Daughters, Super Moon Bakery, Xi'an Famous Foods, Nam Wah, Tasty Hand Pulled Noodles, Great NY Noodle Town(all personal favorites) are all close. Attaboy(my favorite bar/speakeasy) is within stumbling distance. The updated room 414 was super cozy with heated tile floors on the bathroom, a walk in shower, big fluffy towels, room decor with a nice mix of old brick and wood including wood floors, very soft toilet paper(not that sand paper stuff), beautiful lobbies on 2 floors, extremely friendly and helpful staff, and an open concept closet system consisting of antique pipes and shelves under the entertainment area. Drawbacks for the high maintenance traveler would be: thin walls, sub par pillows, small room and bathroom(it's Manhattan and an old building that should be expected), lack of a hotel bar, the stairs, large king side bed was overly springy, no true closet and lack of views from the rooms. I'd definitely consider on my next stay in Manhattan.

title: Great value and location for a family trip
text: I booked at Sohotel due to it’s proximity to restaurants and points of interest that we wanted to go to, as well as the ability to accommodate three people.  It was a bonus that we were able to book a “family room” for my wife and daughter and I because it has three beds.  This was great as we all enjoyed our own beds to stretch out on after walking many miles each day.   We were able to drop our bags on arrival in the morning and have them held after checkout as well.  When needing an iron and ironing board, the staff was quick to deliver to our room.  There are restaurants everywhere surrounding the property, including one attached to the hotel and two others in the same building.  The staff was very helpful and attentive, the room clean and comfortable (the beds were excellent) and reasonable in price, and the location convenient to public transit.  We would definitely stay at Sohotel next time we are in New York.

title: Great location, friendly staff and service
text: This is a nice boutique hotel in a great location with friendly staff and service.  Its close to the East Village with lots of great restaurants, bars and art galleries.  If you are looking t a unique park, it is walking distance to Pier 32 on the East River with great views of both the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridge.  And of course you are close to Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown.  The price is reasonable and the rooms are very comfortable and clean.

title: Great Location
text:
Good location, the room are not comfortable and noisy with the neighbors, large bed but no place around, no place to sit and work, bathroom so small.
Services id at minimum, not very friendly. Price is high if front of the value.

title: Super hotel in hartje Soho
text: Locatie is perfect, diverse leuke eettentjes in de buurt (check TripAdvisor). Wij verbleven in de deluxe familiesuite. Heerlijk ruim voor een gezin met 2 pubers. Zou het hotel zeker aanraden en er een volgende keer opnieuw verblijven.

title: Great hotel!! A gem in NYC
text: Had to come to NYC for a work trip and found this beautiful funky gem in SoHo area. Staff is amazing and a great help. Made my stay as well as my teams' - a very enjoyable one. Was impressed with everything about the hotel. Would highly recommend.

title: Family trip in NYC
text:
We booked for 6 nights a family room. Beds are of good quality, decoration is great with a large and comfortable common space. Service is fine (except you get charged a $19 service fee everyday even though, due to COVID, clean-up is on request - in our case 2 times only).
Good location to eat out and tour in the city.
Noisy on Thursday and Friday nights, otherwise good.

title: Good overall
text: Great hotel, nice rooms for the price, just wish there was an elevator but we had help with an employee carrying out suitcases down but not up. Great coffee in the morning at the coffee station. I would stay there again.

title: Mr
text: Great location, between LES and Soho, next to trendy bars and restaurants. Friendly staff, that keep lugagges and book taxis.Clean hotel. Beautiful and quiet rooms. Only downside is the lack of bar/ food in the nicely-designed lobby.

title: Great boutique style hotel
text: Lovely hotel, small rooms but it’s NYC so what do you expect!  The bathrooms need an update but they’re adequate. Hotel decor is lovely.  Disappointed that bar was closed but plenty of local options.  Staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, thank you all.

title: Great Location and Decor
text: Love the hotel vibe and decor — very cute! The property management was professional and friendly. I would stay here again. The only negatives were that the fan was covered in dust and there was never any coffee leftover in the reception area when I got my day started.

title: Good stay for families
text: I needed a hotel in the Soho, Chinatown area that had large enough beds to have my young kids fit if they sleep horizontal. I was very pleased with the hotel. The only thing that was difficult was the absence of an elevator, which only was needed during check-in and check-out. If this is difficult for you, ask for assistance at the front desk for someone to bring it up for you. The bathroom was very clean. It would have been nice to have a microwave available for usage in the lobby or on the third floor, but I was able to warm up my food when I asked about a microwave, but someone had to take it with me.

title: Sohotel is Soho cool!!
text: We've stayed at the Sohotel twice now and it is such a fun hotel. Beautiful building and nice, spacious rooms with heated floors. Very clean and a great value compared to other hotels. They do not have an elevator but they are very helpful with the bags. Also, no coffee during the week, which must be a covid thing. But tons of coffee right around the hotel. We will stay again for sure.

title: Absolutely fantastic hotel
text: Sohotel is a wonderful place to stay! The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, the rooms are beautiful, and it is well located to be able to explore everything you want to see in the city. We stayed for a bachelorette party, and had the perfect boutique hotel experience.

title: 4 nuits au sohotel
text:
J’ai passé 4 nuits au Sohotel pour une découverte de New York en famille
D’abord, la situation de l’hôtel est très bonne en plein little italy avec plein de restaurants italiens proches, à 2 pas de china town, et non loin à pied de Soho, Tribeca ou WTC
Le rapport qualité prix est plutôt correct car l’hôtel a une approche low cost (pas de petit déjeuner et nettoyage des chambres seulement à la demande)
Les chambres sont propres et dans une déco industrielle typique de NY. Les salles de bain sont très bien même si la robinetterie pourrait être améliorée 
Seul bémol : le rdc de l’hôtel est un restaurant bar qui ferme à 3h du matin. Il y a de la musique jusqu’à 3h, et nous avons dû demander à changer de chambre après la première nuit. Une fois dans la nouvelle chambre, nous étions au calme. Demandez les chambres en étage !

title: Here's the deal
text:
this is a perfect hotel if you are planning on spending your time in NYC out and about.
It is in a GREAT location. Chinatown, Bowery, Little Italy, Soho, all of downtown...
It is a no frills place, but clean and cool and safe and nice. You won't want to hang out all day in your room (small) and no real amenities to speak of, but the bed was comfortable and I did not hear any excessive noise from the hotel or the street and I was on the 2nd floor.  Highly recommend as a place to lay your head. Go somewhere else if you want room service and a great view and the "NYC HOTEL" experience.

title: Welcome to the Bowery
text:
I have never stayed in lower Manhattan or the Bowery until this trip . I was looking for a different part of town to explore. The advertisement I read for the Sohotel seemed interesting. Everyone at the hotel went out of their way to be of assistance to me and my family. The room is large by Manhattan standards and attractive. The floor of the bathroom is heated, which I loved. The mattress was very comfortable and accommodating.
 The immediate neighborhood , historically industrial, now has coffee shops and an abundance of excellent restaurants. It is a short walk to the Tenement Museum and the New Museum. It's it's a stones throw from Chinatown and what was historically Little Italy. It is a short walk to Canal and a slightly longer lot walk to Houston.  For other sites the subway is easily accessible with a short walk in any direction. You can eat, and go to a pretty good neighborhood bar, without really leaving the building.
A couple of small things to consider-1) there was no phone or clock in the room. In a world where there were four cell phones in my room that was hardly a problem, it just seemed unusual.
2) There was a refrigerator, but no microwave. I don't need a refrigerator or a microwave in my hotel room in New York. The fact that there was one without the other, however,  just seemed a little strange. 3) Due to the historic nature of the hotel ,there is no elevator. We were three flights of stairs up. It was not a huge problem just something that you need to be aware of. They graciously offered to carry all of our suitcases up and down for us. There  is an accommodating staff. I have no doubt had we have known of the lack of elevator when we made our reservation, they would have placed us on a lower floor.  I have  strayed all over Manhattan in the the last 40 years. This hotel met all of my needs.

title: Not as advertised
text: This hotel might have some nice rooms, but we got put in a really shabby room with terrible ventilation, right under a very busy stairway, so it was loud from people walking up and down stairs, and the noise from heating and cooling system was unbearably loud too. Room was also very small.

title: Sohotel Review
text: Price was reasonable and room accommodated all of my family members (5). Overall, the cleanliness, amenities, and accommodations were average or below average. The advertisement of a restaurant was misleading.

title: Too loud - no sound insulation.
text: The hotel is beautiful, the room is small but attractive. Unfortunately, I got a terrible night's sleep both nights I stayed. The room door is thin and any noise in the hallway carries right into the room. People are banging doors shut all night long constantly waking me up.

title: Sohotel
text: Great location in Lower Manhattan. Close to transit, shopping and Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho. Quiet and comfortable rooms. Comfortable beds and quality towels. Interesting historical building with cool renovation and interior design. Standard rooms are smallish but functional.

title: Cozy hotel
text: Hotel was nice and cozy. Staff was friendly and willing to help. Only issue is that there is no elevator which make is difficult if you’re on a higher floor. Other then that it was a great experience and definitely would be back.

title: Charming hotel
text:
Great small boutique hotel, perfect Soho/LES location, beautiful lobby, historic building. 
Rooms are basic, exposed brick walls, nothing fancy but serves the purpose. I found the room temperature very hot, had to turn AC on at night. 
Pros: location, value
Cons : no elevator, no coffee or tea (they do charge a service fee, which includes it)

title: Sohotel on Broome
text: If climbing stairs is an issue book in the 200's or 300's. Definitely a good value for the money. Convenient to B & D & 6 Subway lines. Economy rooms are small but adequate. Premium rooms are nice. Heated bathroom floor was nice too.

title: Loud music
text: Hotel was OK but the bar played loud music until 3am. No sleep possible! The lobby personnel seemed not even to understand the problem. Otherwise good location and acceptable standard of an interesting hotel.

title: Great historical boutique experience in one of the best NYC locations
text: Excellent staff and service plus nice rooms to boot. Love the location and decor. Darnette is especially nice and goes out of her way to help. Have stayed here twice and both times the experience was wonderful.

title: DO NOT BOOK
text: The hotel looks cute online but that’s where the praise ends. There is NO ELEVATOR so you have to haul your bags up multiple flights of stairs. The wifi doesn’t work, the bar is SO LOUD and there is a club somewhere that blasts music until 3am. And then, when I checked out, they charged a random $100 “service fee” for nothing. Such a scam. Avoid avoid avoid.

title: boutique hotel
text: very cute hotel. location is not so much Soho but Chinatown. not the best area but two blocks away gets cleaner and nicer. rooms are a good size but dark and cold. easy walk to Little Italy. staff was nice.  rooms clean. price is right for location

title: Bien mais un peu cher
text:
Hotel avec un certain cachet mais un peu cher. Salle de bain un peu petite. Nous avions 2 chambres. Une donnait sur la rue et était bruyante. Nous sommes juste au dessus d’une espèce de bar-restaurant.... l’autre était à l’arrière et était plus calme.
Chambres surchauffée. Nous avons du mettre l’air co en décembre !!

title: Great quality
text: Clean, roomy, cute, and convenient!! Plus the bathroom was high quality (tile floor, towel warmer, glass barrier instead of shower curtain, etc). Got a great deal for New Years, will definnitely recommend

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text: Friendly, helpful staff. Location was perfect. Rooms and common areas were cozy and kept extremely clean. It was jsut my husband and I, but we decided to upgrade to the premium king room. We were very impressed with the space - enough room to move around and get comfortable. The bathroom gets bonus points for heated floors.

title: Love The Sohotel
text: My family of five visited a few days before Christmas. Everything was exceptional from the beginning to end of our stay. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful, friendly, and accommodating. The hotel’s interior design is gorgeous and eclectic and it smells divine. It’s located close to the Subway and you can easily travel to wherever you want to go in Brooklyn and Manhattan. We will definitely be staying again!

title: Christmas trip
text: Great stay. Beautiful, eclectic hotel. Great ambience. Convenient location. Very clean. Great, friendly staff. Would stay here again for a quick getaway. Brilliant shops just a short walk away. Brooklyn bridge 10 minute walk

title: Getting my NYC Fix
text: Lived in NYC for 20 years and came back for the holiday. Wanted to stay in a different part of the city. Hotel was exactly what I was looking for - boutique, appointed, quiet room, clean room, warm ambience for the holidays. Only comment would be the surrounding city block of the hotel is rather empty store fronts but then go one more block and you’re in little Italy and Chinatown which are fun to explore

title: Terrifying experience
text:
I selected this hotel because of its location but let me advise you to stay away from this place. 
After checking in with a nice lady that was managing the hotel all by herself (only one person to check in, for reception, check out, luggages etc...) I checked in to my room. I left for 2 hours for a meeting downtown when I came back my entire room was under water. Water was pouring from the ceiling! Some of my luggages got wet on the floor. My computer was on the desk, I got lucky enough to arrive after 2 hours and not 3 hours later I would have lost my computer....! When I realized what happened I packed my belongings urgently and left the room to tell the team about the terrible incident. But while arriving at the desk the same lady was alone with lines of clients, I had to interrupt her as the water was running in the hallway but it didn't seem to worry her. She eventually send someone to take a look and they came back 20 min later. Not feeling so worry about it, replying that it can happen from time to time when someone is leaving the bath running upstairs, really???
Then they rebook me to another room much smaller, I had to go there with all my luggages without help (did I tell you that they do not have elevators?) when I came back questioning the room as I didn't even have a place to position my computer (it was a bed and a wall..) the lady told me that I was too shaky so she just relocated me fast somewhere... honestly this is the worst experience I had in my entire life and I am travelling weekly to hotels...  Also to mention that sheets are poor quality and smells products, there are no place to get a water in the hotel or a warm tea. The only thing they have is the location and they are taking advantage of it.

title: Not ADA compliant!!!
text:
When I checked in, the first impressions:  fun lobby;  steep stairway to climb with luggage;  receptionist with COVID mask below the nose.  The receptionist was helpful about my being early for checkin.  I requested to stay on the 2nd floor, and when I returned, my bags were already in the room.

The room was small, the bathroom quite compact, the decor was fun.  Plusses:  ceiling fan, firm mattress, clean room.  Things I expected that weren't there:  coffee maker; closet (there was a pipe on the wall near the door, with hangers overlapping); someplace to open my suitcase (I used one of the two bedside tables, since I was traveling alone) or to store clothing (there was a long narrow shelf table, but the single drawer in the room was the under-shelf safe); a chair (there was a stool).  Because of COVID, there was no daily room cleaning, though I was told to ask the desk for whatever I needed.  I was too preoccupied to ask for a coffee maker, but I think that they meant bathroom amenities.

The bathroom came with 2 sets of comfortable towels, on the one towel rack, and soap, plus three dispensers in the little shower (shampoo, body wash, conditioner), all scented with peppermint and lavender.  

I was very tired when I slept there, so the noise of the steam pipes and perhaps traces of music from a restaurant or bar below didn't bother me.  I could clearly hear conversations and footsteps from the hall in the morning.  

I've walked by and admired the lobby in the past, but didn't end up spending time there on this trip, because COVID and because it wasn't a leisurely trip.  Perhaps the lack of a comfortable chair in the room would be compensated for by the lobby, in a non-pandemic time.  Similarly, I do not fault them for lack of daily room-cleaning.  The bed was easily made.

title: Beautiful and cozy hotel
text: As soon as we walked in to the lobby, the smell of the hotel is so relaxing and tranquil.. the staff was friendly and our room was just as in the pictures. With the hustle and bustle of the city, nice to have a quiet and homey hotel to come back to and recharge.

title: Worse hotel ever
text: Terrible hotel. Very small, old bathroom with a shower that leaked water onto the floor, mold along the sealants, cracked top of the plastic shower stall. Noisy paper thin walls. I heard everyone’s conversation and hair dryer. No disclosure there was no elevator or security. I saw a non hotel guest charging his phone in the lobby since the receptionist is several series of stairs up. Never stay here again. Very expensive for such a small room with no amenities.  Beautiful landmark building which in this case was just dilapidated.

title: Great Customer Service
text: This hotel provides really incredible customer service. I had a few trunks shipped to the hotel for my arrival and they were very accommodating for all of my needs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The quaint rooms were well decorated and very comfortable.

title: great place
text:
great staff and very nice hotel. Everyone was super friendly and made our stay perfect.  We would definitely return here.                                                                                                                          
Location is close to subway and lots of fantastic restaurants nearby.  Great value and large rooms.

title: A little gem
text: Lovely boutique gem of a place in Little Italy/SoHo/Chinatown/Bowery. Room was perfect as a place to sleep, close to subway, nice nooks throughout to sit and read. Fun design and decoration. Shopping, amenities, food and museums all nearby.

title: Great stay at the Sohotel
text: Place and staff were great rooms a bit small and different depending on the room but that’s boutique hotels for you . I would definitely recommend based on the price and the location of the hotel. Positive experience would return

title: Great location to explore
text: The Sohotel is perfectly located to explore New York. We stayed in a 4 person room (2 queen beds) and we were happy with the accommodations. The rooms and bathroom are a bit worn, however, for the price and location, it's a great stay, especially if you don't plan on spending a ton of time in your room.

title: Great location!
text: We received fantastic service. They were extremely helpful, as it was our first time in NY and it was in a great location. Great food within walking distance in every direction and easy access to subway.

title: Not a good experience
text: We got here on Sunday night and were told that an additional$20 service fee per day would be charged but that there wouldn't be any cleaning except for new towels and trash pick up. I am not sure what the additional service fee is for, if the beds don't get made and the room doesn't get cleaned. There is no phone in the room to call the front desk. There is no fridge and the TV doesn't work.

title: Cool Space
text: It's a very cool hotel, but the furniture in the lobby is a bit worn.  There isn't an elevator (which we were aware of) and they will carry your luggage up to your room.  We had 2 different type of rooms.  My daughters room was "Deluxe" and I upgraded to the premium.  The Deluxe was literally right next door to the front desk.  She could hear every person checking in . Not just noise, but the entire conversations.  I can't imagine where they put the folks who opt for the "Standard" room.  The "Premium" is on the 4th floor (remember: NO elevator :)  The room was nice and probably renovated more recently, but the mirror was cracked, the window wouldn't lock and stay shut and the TV kept losing sound.  The TV issue was a connection issue, not TV specific.  The biggest issue at this hotel.. NO COFFEE!  It's seems absurd that it's not provided anywhere in the hotel.  If you don't want to put coffee makers in the room, at least serve it in the lobby.  The closet place to buy coffee was the next block (not far) but they don't open until 8:00 a.m.  Just seems like a weird thing to skimp on.  Ultimately, it's a nice hotel.  I don't think the upgrades are worth it, especially since we weren't in our rooms for anything other than sleeping.

title: Kids woke up covered in bites
text: We had 3 beds in our room.  My husband and I slept in one and were fine.  My young sons slept in the other and woke up covered in bites.  We had an emergency trip to the ER for an unrelated reason for my youngest son and they confirmed they looked like bedbug bites. The hotel moved us but offered no compensation.

title: Great little gem!
text: Easy to find location, the Sohotel is a lovely boutique hotel with all the amenities needed for a quick trip to NY.  The room was not huge, but we already knew that from descriptions by other residents, however the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was really well appointed.  City sounds were inevitably audible in the morning, but not problematic.

title: Terrific neighbourhood- and accommodations!
text: Wonderful hotel near Little Italy, Nolita and Chinatown. Enough space for a family of 5 - and that is always a challenge. The staff are why we will return. They are friendly and available at all times. Close to the Subway system. Incredible dining and stores in the area!!

title: really crummy bathroom -- not as advertised online
text: The room was generally OK, but the bathroom in the standard room was tiny and very run down...nothing like the pictures online.  I could hardly turn around in the shower stall and the sink and toilet were old and worn.  I told the clerk that I was very disappointed and that the pictures online were misleading, but they offered no apology.  I won't be staying at this hotel in the future.

title: Perfect location to explore
text: Great proximity to many lower Manhattan neighborhoods. Very cool, “Sohoesque” vibe. Walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, Nolita, Broadway, West Side. Lots of food options. Cool playground for kids nearby on Spring St. Amenities limited by Covid, but we’d definitely stay again!

title: Loud, tiny rooms, no customer service, a nightly service fee for nothing
text: Don't stay here.  This hotel is a hostel (unless you want a hostel experience).  The rooms are tiny and very noisy.  There is no coffee in the rooms.  Some of the rooms are above nightclubs, others are above generators that vibrate the entire bed.  When you attempt to discuss with the management, the staff is surly.  They charge you a $20 nightly service fee that as far as I can tell doesn't cover anything as there aren't any actual services at this hotel.  Overall, if you want a really disappointing stay in NYC, this would be your best best.

title: Average Experience
text: Location was close to the D train which was good, but restaurants nearby were all closed. Downfall is there is no elevator and I was traveling with a sprained ankle. Noise level from other guests is OUTRAGEOUSLY loud (just from people walking in the hallway!). The bed was also super squeaky even just from breathing and my boyfriend could barely fit around the bed without hitting the wall or his shins since the room was so teeny tiny despite being a “deluxe” room. Overall it was clean and an okay location but I won’t stay again most likely.

title: Good times in a cool place
text: This hotel is great for a night out in the city. The neighborhood has awesome bars and restaurants to try including one on the first floor of the hotel. Our room had very comfy beds, a smart TV, and a small refrigerator. The bathroom was standard with plenty of towels. The only strange thing was that our room had a “master switch” that turned off all of the lights, including the ones in the bathroom. If that switch was on there were three lights right above the beds that were always on. If it was switched off you had to pee in complete darkness. And our room was above the bar so there was a dull thump of the bass from them till late.

title: Swanky hotel
text: Our family had a pleasant stay here for one night. There was a clean, fresh scent that greeted us as we entered the hotel only to be followed by the beautiful decor. The staff was friendly and held our luggage until check-in without any problems. Our room was clean but a little tight with 4 of us in the room, but we were only there to shower and sleep. The beds were comfortable but there was a little trial and error getting the temperature just right. The location was great and there many restaurant choices. They had vending machines but no breakfast available, but as said above, there is no shortage of amazing restaurants. Check-out was simple, the hosts were friendly and accommodating. I would definitely stay again!

title: Great location!
text:
Our stay was great, within walking distance from of several dining options & central to subway access. The decor & design were super fun and detailed. Over very clean. 

We will definitely be returning soon!

title: Over priced - under delivered.
text: Steer clear! Beautiful old hotel - room was clean and bed was comfortable. No one was around when we checked in on Friday night at 7pm - we waited a long time. A woman on the phone in an adjacent office could not be bothered to help us check in. No elevator. No bellhop. No amenities. No in-room or in-lobby coffee. No housekeeping  and no way to request it because the desk was always unattended. VERY VERY NOISY at night - yelling and banging doors (probably because no manager around. - and that explains the $250 incidentals fee held at the start) No room service that I could find. Super disappointed.

title: Great space for family
text: With 3 grown kids and 2 adults it is difficult to find one hotel room to fit everyone. This space included 2 queen beds and one twin fitting all of us just great. Beautiful space and functional. Would have liked a fridge and better lighting, but location to subway and many shops restaurants was wonderful. Would stay here again.

title: Sohotel review
text: Stay was awful experience.  No elevator so had to carry bags up flights of stairs.  Room was too small overall, the bathroom was tiny and the shower leaked and was so small could hardly turn. I would definitely not recommend Sohotel to any friend.

title: Average hotel
text: The hotel location is really good. Many restaurants and shops around.The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The room size was great but the bathroom does not fit two people at once. The shower was very small. The room we stayed on the TV wasn't working. I were a little disappointed... I would just come back if I need to stay close to Soho otherwise I would try another hotel.

title: We had a good time
text: This hotel was in a great location, and near a subway entrance. There was no coffee maker in the room and I couldn't find any in the lobby, but in the hotel's defense I never asked. It was a little pricy, but again, it's in a great location and we needed a room for 5 adults. Overall we enjoyed it.

title: Loved this hotel!
text:
Celebration of my husband’s birthday!  We had the King Jr Suite and it was perfect! We had beautiful weather and a great view of the Bowery. Bed was extremely comfy and was nice to have the couch and chairs as we had a couple of friends swing by for some pre-party drinks. Everything was perfect.  Note no elevator but that didn’t bother us one bit and we were on the top floor (4th). 

We highly recommend staying here!

title: Sohotel Overcharging ; Do NOT stay at Sohotel
text:
Do NOT stay in Sohotel! The management are dishonest and have refused to reimburse my unsuspecting son’s credit card for doublecharging him $228.47  on NYC Sales and State Tax and a $20 daily charge for a 10-day stay I booked with them on British Airways. My British Airways confirmation clearly stated that the £2,347.90 I paid upfront “included taxes, fees, and charges unless otherwise stated”. Yet Sohotel charged my unsuspecting $228.47 more than they should have.  
. They first offered me a $200 voucher as a “goodwill gesture”, which I refused. Would you accept a $200 voucher from a shoe store that has overcharged you by $228.47  for two pair of shoes when you bought one pair? Sohotel then claimed that British Airways booked through Expedia and sent an expedia snapshot that taxes and service charges were not included. Yet the expedia snapshot they sent me here was a generic one that did not include my family members’ names or the dates of stay. 

I am not allowed to show you links to my bills and sohotel's lame response due to trip advisor rules.

Sohotel put a cloud on a very nice holiday in New York with my family. You would have expected that Sohotel would welcome back customers after a very difficult 2 years of the pandemic. Instead, they try to doublecharge a young unsuspecting son of mine by doublecharging him for expenses I already paid for.

title: Very disappointing hotel.
text:
The Sohotel over charged us at checkout by double charging us tax and service. Even though they eventually admitted they did this by checking our documentation, they will only give us a credit for a lesser amount rather than refund us the full amount. They have been extremely unresponsive and unpleasant about the whole issue which could have been resolved immediately instead of dragging it out. Very dishonest and unpleaseant to deal with. The issue is still unresolved. 
Hotel very average at best. Rooms dark, not very clean and  terrible service. Will not be staying there again.

title: Very friendly staff, quaint and charming place.
text: Great location, very friendly staff and charming hotel. Loved our room. The beds so comfy. The bathroom floors heated. Although there is no elevator, the staff helped with luggage. I just wish they had coffee available on site for those who need it very early.

title: 9/11 Stay
text: Great location and accommodations. Search for a hotel that had queen size beds instead of a full. They have a room configuration that is awesome for families. Two queens and a twin.  The car service was great thru the hotel. No problems at all. Drivers on time and friendly. The hotel staff friendly and attentive. Responded to all inquiries. The best thing was that you can’t hear the other guests when in your room. Solid walls. Would recommend. One piece of advice pack only what you can carry up stairs. No elevator.

title: Great Location but Little Else
text: This best things about this hotel is the great A/C and ceiling fan, and the great location.  Having said that, SMALL would be an understatement for our room and bathroom.  I have seen elevators that are bigger, and BTW, there is no elevator!  My guess is there’s no room for amenities such as a box of facial tissue, a phone, a coffee pot or even something to heat water, because there were none of these things in the room or available for the asking.  The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows were flat. Apparently, one has the strongly suggested option to upgrade for an additional $60 a night, but they don’t mention if the room would be larger or if that includes a box of tissue!.  Other than that, the place is great!

title: Quaint hotel in great neighborhood
text: Stayed here for a mother-daughter trip. We have visited NY numerous times and this neighborhood is one of our favorite. The hotel is adorable and the rooms have a lot of character. It was perfect for our needs. There are plenty of eating options nearby and the subway is close. I would highly recommend this hotel for people who are familiar with NYC and don't need any sort of concierge service or information. If it's your first time and you have a lot of questions or need information on sightseeing tours, then this hotel is probably not for you.

title: 10/10 would stay again
text: From the moment we checked-in, it was amazing. Hotel staff was accommodating from the beginning to the end of our time there. Our room was perfect and had pretty much everything we needed. The heated floor in the bathroom could have been a little warmer but no real complaints here.

title: My stay for EZOO 2021
text: The vibe was right from the first step into the building! Very hip, good vibes, clean & cultured! Loved this hotel would go back for sure !! The room wasn’t spacious enough to run around and do jumping jacks but to sleep & get ready & go for sure, my friends and I had 3 bedroom and it was comfortable, nice, clean, and a good place, for a great price! Very easy going !

title: Una excelente y hotel cómodo
text:
El hotel tiene una excelente ubicación, cerca de muchos restaurantes muy bueno y de tiendas, así como de la estación del metro.
Habitación cómoda y limpia, cama confortables.
En general un buen lugar para ir en familia o en pareja

title: 다시 오고싶지 않음
text: 비오는날 방에 물이샘. 호텔방 도어락이 고장나서 밤에 모르는사람이 방에 들어와서 너무 무서웠음. 호텔직원이 내가 문을 세게 꽝 닫지않아서 안잠긴거라고 말했음. 방에 전화기가 없어서 서비스를 요청하려면 프론트데스크까지 가야함. 엘리베이터가 없음

title: Great Location!
text: This hotel is a great hotel and the perfect location next to little Italy, nolita, shopping and subways. I stayed in Super Delux which has three beds and it was perfect. They have a restaurant downstairs but unfortunately I didn’t try it. It looked great through.

title: My go to in NYC
text: I had an amazing experience staying at the Sohotel! Rooms were very clean. I love the heated floors in the bathroom and the USB ports in the room. I love the aesthetic of the hotel as well. I was able to get a couple cool pictures for social media. Plenty of train stations in walking distance. There’s also several restaurants on the same street which makes it convenient if you don’t want to go to far for food. Overall I had an amazing stay!

title: Perfect for families
text: Our first time sleeping in New York did not disappoint! This location was convenient to the things we were doing in the area and also very decently priced. I read the reviews first and find them to be incredibly accurate. Clean, friendly, convenient, comfortable, fun, swanky, modern, are just some things I can say about it. I typed more in my review on their website but thoroughly impressed by everything here and will absolutely stay again!

title: Impressive
text: The SoHotel is a boutique style hotel with a great staff, it has sophisticated décor on every floor, it is well priced and is conveniently located. SoHotel is just steps away from Chinatown and Little Italy and within walking distance to the Lower East Side. After we checked out we took a short stroll to the Manhattan Bridge for some views. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Friends Trip
text: Great base for fun in NYC!  Awesome staff and clean and comfortable rooms.  Hotel is right in the middle of some great neighborhoods--some of that you can hear in the rooms.  However, that is to be expected.  Highly recommend.

title: Great location, but where's the door?
text:
Excellent location right by Little Italy and Chinatown. Be aware: We walked past the front door twice before venturing in, STILL unsure if this was actually the hotel or not. Better street-level and front-door signage is sorely needed.

We booked a "family room" with two queens and one single bed; a great option for families. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean. However, the bathroom and shower were significantly smaller than average (even by NYC standards), so larger people should find other accommodations. 

Also, perhaps because of Covid, there was no housekeeping service, although we could have requested extra towels if needed. Another thing to keep in mind: Request a room higher than 2nd floor if music from the downstairs bars could be an issue.

Traveling to this neighborhood again, I would be willing to stay here again, but would also explore other options.

title: Sohotel
text: Very good.  We needed somewhere in Little Italy near my daughter's apartment.  This hotel was perfect; clean, quiet, large room and comfortable bed.  Easy access to everything we needed.  All staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Family friendly hotel
text: We stayed for five nights and the staff was very kind, accommodating and helpful. Room was nice and clean, The hotel is very well located close to Little Italy, Chinatown and Soho, many options for food around. I would definitely recommend to friends and family and stay there again as well.

title: Nice, but not in a great neighborhood
text: NIce hotel.  Clean and as described.  Not the best neighborhood though.  We also got a parking ticket after only 10 minutes of having our car out front unloading our luggage...$95!  They need to do something about that.

title: Girls weekend
text:
Very Clean and comfortable room, it was my friend and our three adult children and we fit nicely,good location, staff was very friendly 
Loved the decor and architecture of building, Little Italy was right just a few block up

title: Bad service , unprofessional
text: Bad service, unprofessional dirty room, no room service, no clean towels. We tried to fix the situation and to discuss with the manager but they didn’t accommodate our problems with the proper solutions. We left with no answer and no solution.

title: A cute, quirky & clean hotel with amazing staff & great location!
text: Loved our stay!  Hard to find one room for 5 adults but this one fit the bill.  With a very friendly, responsive & accommodating staff, super cool & funky vibe and great location - we’ll definitely be back!!!

title: A fantastic birthday trip!
text: The hotel is phenomenal and the staff is incredibly friendly. The restaurant Piacere was exceptional! The location was a little more out of the way than I had originally thought, but it's a charming neighborhood nonetheless! I will definitely be back!

title: Fun hotel in Manhattan
text: Our family of 5 enjoyed nearly a week at Sohotel and we look forward to staying here again the next time we come back to NYC. The hotel is in a great location in lower Manhattan. They provide a great value in that can accommodate 5 grown people in one room - something that usually requires a large suite or two rooms in a hotel, or a larger place in an AirBNB. The hotel is a walk-up. Reception is on the second floor, and there is no elevator, so youi will need to carry your bags up stairs to get to reception and your room. The vibe of the hotel is great with the furniture in the lower lobby and throughout the floors. The staff was very nice. We arrived around 12:30 in the afternoon hoping to store our bags and explore the local neighborhood, and they were able to check us into our room early, which was a bonus. The room we had was clean, as was the bathroom. While not used, they provided full sized bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in the shower.

title: No Elevator!!
text: Decor of hotel and location are nice. But that’s it. My room was on the the 4th floor. The exposed brick is nice. Very dark room with poor lighting. No coffee maker in room but amenities says there is free coffee and tea in the lobby. Not true since Covid. No telephone. No microwave. No iron/board. No closet or bench for clothes. No soap dish on sink. Bed semi comfortable but nice cotton sheets. Limited TV stations. Better hotels in NYC for the cost. Great location and the heated bathroom floor is great.

title: Great location & cool vintage rooms
text: If you’re staying here with your family I’d recommend upgrading to the 4th floor rooms. They’re more spacious, have central air and have a mini fridge inside. The location is great. The WiFi is great. There’s not really any amenities but with so many stores around it doesn’t really matter.

title: Hidden fee
text: This hotel seems cheaper, but after the extra $20night they tack on to your deposit, it’s just as much as hotels with elevators and bars. NYC rooms are known to be small, but you can’t even pull the desk chair out all the way.

title: Excellent room space and value, great location, but poor service overall from the staff.
text: I traveled with a friend, and we were able to get a beautiful room with 2 queen beds and a sitting area for a great value, and the hotel has a great location, hence the 4 star rating. The only helpful staff was the day we checked out; it was good we were pretty comfortable with figuring out public transportation and other questions independently, because the staff was not visible, helpful or friendly otherwise.

title: Super stay!
text: Great place to stay.  Room was beautiful and super clean.  Staff was extremely pleasant snd helpful. Love the ambiance and little nooks and crannies to sit and relax in when not in the room. Lots of fun snd good restaurants in walking distance.

title: Nice, budget-friendly hotel
text:
Pros: Very cute and quirky hotel. The staff was very friendly. I thought the room was spacious compared to other NYC hotels I’ve stayed in. I was concerned about managing 5 suitcases in a NYC hotel, but our room had 4 industrial shelves that worked perfectly to store our open suitcases without taking up any floor space. The hotel and room were exactly as pictured on the website. If you would like housekeeping services, you have to request it. I actually prefer this and hope this becomes a permanent thing post-covid. They did a great job when we requested it and also promptly took care of a maintenance issue. It was very nice to have 3 beds for our family of 5. There is no shortage of restaurants since Little Italy, Chinatown, and Soho are all a short walk from the hotel. 

Cons: The complimentary coffee service is discontinued due to covid. This was kind of a big deal for our coffee-dependent family since it added another $25+ to each day. I think it is a bit of a stretch to say the hotel is in Soho since it is definitely not on cobblestone streets, surrounded by trendy boutiques and restaurants. We had no view at all from our 2nd floor room, facing north. I don’t know if other rooms had a good view though. Since there is a bar in the hotel, I’m not sure when/if the door to the hotel is ever locked. There was often no employees in sight, so it seemed that anyone could wander in at any time. 

Overall, we were very happy with the hotel and would consider staying here again.

title: Heated Bathroom Floor!
text:
Need I write more...but seriously, the room was cute and clean with lots of counter space for your belongings. They had a Kodak camera in my room that I didn't get a chance to use but I thought was a cool feature. 

Only negative is that they do not have an elevator. I wanted to return with my mom in November but was told there is no handicap option.

title: super cool hotel
text: Just a quick overnight in the city to catch a show.  This place was inexpensive, super cool and convenient, and the room was amazing.  Heated bathroom floors and an amazing rain shower head was the best

title: At this point a hotel that doesn’t offer housekeeping service its lazy and they don’t care about costumers
text: Not a good stay, noisy and i had poor sleep walls are thin you can hear everything couldn’t sleep   and the housekeeping it’s silly at this point, not to offer it its lazy and not caring gor your client

title: A gem!
text: We had 3 guests. Our room was very clean, beds comfortable and hotel was quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. The neighborhood was okay, no problems. Plenty of food options within a five minute walk.

title: Family vacation for 5
text:
NO PARKING AVAILABLE AT THIS HOTEL!!! Every website references parking/valet parking available at this hotel. IT IS NOT AVAILABLE!!! 5 BLOCK WALK FROM PARKING. I had 3 small kids and luggage to drag 5 blocks
 I would not have booked here if I had known there was no parking.

title: Sohotel great stay
text: This hotel was in a great location for our visit.  Close to the subway and all the things we wanted to see during our stay.  Check in was easy and Check out was even easier.  The hotel had all of the things we needed ready for us when we arrived.

title: Great stay
text: Great hotel. Very stylish excellent location. Its near everything.  We met the owners who were super nice and very accommodating. We couldn't have been happier with our stay. Now's an excellent time to visit NYC since tourists aren't really back yet.

title: Worst place in NY
text: We paid a 19.99 per day for WiFi and “room service” but the WiFi was horrible and room service was declined due to “covid restrictions”. However they were able to come in and change our bathroom trash bags and provide towels and bed sheets when WE WERE STILL IN THE ROOM, but can’t make our bed? What sense does that make?  When I asked for extra bed sheets because the previous ones they provided fell on the floor (in front of employee) we were asked to give an explanation to why we needed more. The employee brings the extra sheets and tells me that they needed to tell management they we needed so many sheets as if we were stealing them when he was the one that drop the first one in the first place. We asked were water bottles, told us they could only give us two bottles when we were 5 guests in total then pointed us to the vending machines. This hotel was horrible with unpleasant employees , nonsense rules and regulations, and ridiculous charges without services provided that were promised.  Never again

title: Ok stay good location
text: The location is good. The staff was helpful. The hotel is stylish and clean. Lots to do in the area. Wasn’t happy about room damage deposit and the room window didn’t open for better sleep.  Overall my stay was good and convenient location.

title: Great location, but room was much worse than shown in pictures
text: Amazing location and very friendly staff! BUT room was super tiny and old (but too be fair, it was very clean!) when i asked why it’s so old and nothing like was shown on pictures when i booked it, receptionist smiled and said that they advertise only updated rooms ( and if i want to get any of those i need to pay for an upgrade)! It was a disappointing experience.

title: They claim they are boutique
text: This hotel has no standard amenities: in room coffee, an iron, bathrobe, nor phone. The alarm in the empty room next door went of in the middle of the night. With no phone to call the front desk I had to get my phone, look up their number, and call. It ruined my sleep. In the morning, instead of making any amends (small compensation, future discount) I was given excuses.

title: Good location
text: Charming hotel with small rooms but the location is excellent and the lobby is beautiful. Very easy check-in. Very easy check-out. Would recommend for a short stay in Manhattan. Close to a lot of great neighborhoods.

title: Decent
text: There was a slight blip with the room but overall great experience. It did not impact our stay. The fact that the room had three beds instead of the usual two was the main reason as to why this specific hotel was chosen.

title: Birthday Girl Slumber Party
text: Fun, quirky hotel that worked well for a 10 year-old's birthday party with an extra bed for mom! The room was spacious, the lobby had several beautifully decorated areas for the girls to hang out, the location has restaurants in the building for convenience.

title: Great location, great rooms, great staff.
text: From arrival to departure everyone is super helpful.  The rooms were modern and exceptionally clean.  The only thing that was less than perfect is the doors are thin and hallway noise comes right in.  It was a great location and easily accessed the best of Manhattan.

title: Awesome staycation!
text: From start to finish this is a hotel & team that goes above and beyond. Stellar staycation spot 💫 recommend for locals and visitors alike! Covid protocols felt thoughtful and made the rest feel like a getaway.

title: Good Area for travelers
text: The Sohotel was very neat and clean. The area has a lot of places to eat: Little Italy, Chinatown, and many boutique restaurants and bakeries. Location is great, but the rooms are very small. If you are traveling alone or as a couple this would be a great option!

title: best location in lower Manhattan
text: We like the location of the hotel, which is walkable to Soho and Chinatown. Although the room is small, but it is very clean and quiet, which served the purpose since we spent most of time exploring the area and we could easily came back to hotel to rest. We will come back next time.

title: Gorgeous, lovely, comfy, friendly,helpful! Great location. We will be back for sure
text: Great staff, great location. Beautiful, historical building. Right in the heart of all the activity. Rooms were comfy and staff super friendly and helpful. We had everything we needed and enjoyed it very much. Super cool, mod vibe.

title: Not recommended
text: No cleaning during the 2day stay. No elevator. I stayed in the 4th floor but my friends who stayed in the 3rd floor says theres noise from the bar downstairs in the night. In the bathroom, there’s strident sound from the water pipe when turn on the water. ￼The front desk is friendly and kind though.

title: NOLITA’S FINEST!!!
text: Must stay! Amazing area with everything in arms reach. The hotel provides the perfect vibe and architecture that really matches with the energy of Lower East Side. The rooms are amazing with window views and the best bathrooms!

title: Just stay at the Roxy
text: The rooms are tiny, the key system is constantly down, the Roxy nearby has comparable prices, large rooms, bar and restaurant, amenities, better service all around. This hotel did the bare minimum, which is fine, but they absolutely do not go above and beyond.

title: Great staff and nice property for the money
text: The hotel and room were nicer and cleaner that most in the price range I paid. The staff were genuinely pleasant and helpful in every way. Really tough to beat the location, surrounded by so many restaurants

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: The location really can’t be be beat as it’s very close to the heart of everything downtown. The aesthetic is a fun draw in and there are little carefully placed details everywhere - down to the plants having names! Our room was small, but bright and charming, and definitely clean. The only thing we would’ve liked to have but wasn’t available was a refrigerator in the room as well as plush hotel robes. Everything else was delightful from start to finish.

title: THE PERFECT EVERYTHING
text: Great rooms- Great staff- Great price- Great location- Great experience. We needed a family room and this hotel as the perfect one with 2 queen size beds and a twin bed. The brick walls are super unique and cozy. It is right near the shopping area of Soho. The staff walks you to your rooms when you check in..

title: Nice rooms and comfy beds, no amenities
text: The bed was very comfortable and staff was friendly. However, there are simply no amenities available in the rooms or in the lobby. I know COVID affects available of shared amenities, but there should be no reason not to provide some coffee or mini bar options in the room aside from a single bottle of water? Also, the hot water ran brown.

title: Amazing two week stay
text: We had a fantastic stay at the Sohotel. Would absolutely recommend staying here. Beautiful old building, stunning rooms and super friendly staff. You're right in the middle of everything with great access to transport as well.

title: Stay
text: The staff was excellent and the location was great.  They were friendly and accommodating and our room was very nice.  The bathroom is fabulous and the heated floors a luxury.  We didn't want or need for anything.  Everything from check in to check out was perfect

title: Will definitely be back!
text: Such a cute hotel, great location and the staff was so friendly and helpful. There are so many great cafes and restaurants in walking distance.  Wish I found out about this hotel sooner. It will definitely be my go-to hotel in the city.

title: Had an Incredible Experience Despite Covid
text: Dennett, the Front Desk attendant, was incredibly gracious and accommodating. The room was clean the King bed was comfortable, the bathroom floors were heated in which we loved. The decor is funky and fun, but still cohesive. The location was perfect for my wedding dress shopping, so many places to eat. I do recommend making reservations before hand, as Covid makes it tough for walkins. Would definitely recommend this spot to anyone staying Soho!

title: Great Location
text:
Clean rooms. Quirky little hotel in Soho. Customer service was perfect and the location is exactly where you want to be. Will return again when possible. Rooms were semi spacious. It's New York, so I though the rooms were big enough for us.
Cannot fault.

title: SoHotel
text: If you are visiting NYU and want to get a great understanding of the neighborhood, this hotel is for you!  Beautiful comfortable beds, best shower ever and a great remodel on this historic building.  The hosts are amazingly kind and welcoming!  Extremely clean and would come back here in a heartbeat.

title: Anniversary
text: Besides not having housekeeping at the moment unfortunately due to circumstances the stay was great. Was able to extend without any issue. Staff was polite and helpful. Lots of restaurants near by and food and drinks were exquisite.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: Beautiful hotel with close proximity to everything! The hotel was walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge, SoHo, the Village , Little Italy, and Chinatown. The subway is also very close, making travel throughout the city a breeze. Rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: Enjoyed a 3 night stay here. Loved our king room. While the view was “meh” it was truly quiet. Get out of the room if you want to see NYC - and sleep peacefully at night :-) Tricky bit is climbing stairs from Broome St to get to lobby - then climb to your room.  Lots of help though to get your luggage to your room (even at 11:30 at night!). Would come here again...loved the location.

title: Fantastic hotel in a district where you can experience more of the real NY
text: Opted to stay at Sohotel as it is one of the few hotels in NY that offers twin rooms as standard - and Sohotel did not disappoint.  The hotel was spotless and in a great location: loved escaping the mayhem of Times Square to return to a quieter neighbourhood with great restaurants and bars (Fiat Cafe was my favourite).  Really appreciated the cheerful greeting we received each morning from the hotel attendant and his tips on the weather and places to go.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Great location, stylish and good price.
text: My family of five have stayed at this location several times. It was nice to find a place that had enough beds and room for three teenagers and two adults for a fair price. Our stay at Sohotel has always been easy and enjoyable with clean rooms, stylishly decorated, walkable to many popular areas, and close to the subway. Love the neighbourhood!

title: Beautiful hotel with a great location and friendly staff
text: We chose the Sohotel because of the value. They offer familyrooms which fitted our party of 3 perfectly. The hotel is clean and the staff very nice. The hotel is perfectly located in a nice neighbourhood, a subway station is 3 min walking distance. We enjoyed our stay a lot and will return here in the future. Also: the shower and bed were GREAT!! One of the best beds in a hotel I ever slept in.

title: Awesome Trendy Hotel!
text: This hotel is adorable! Super trendy and eclectic. Staff was accommodating and friendly. The room was clean and the location was perfect! Short walks to good shopping and great restaurants. I would for sure stay again!

title: Cathys adventure
text: Loved my stay there.....cool old building, great downntown location...super nice/helpful people! The room decor was hip and well designed, common spaces also very welcoming and attractive! I would stay again.

title: Noisy and construction going on
text: Nowhere in Booking.com was mentioned that there is construction going on. I was given the room next to construction site and tools even thought their occupancy was at 30-40% max. Didn’t sleep all night from the noise once from the bar

title: Great hotel, great location and great service!
text:
We stayed at Sohotel for 4 nights and we loved it. The NY atmosphere of this cosy hotel feels very warm and welcome. The staff is super friendly and always willing to help. Our room wasn’t large but it was very clean and comfortable. The beds were good, the shower was nice and warm... no complaints whatsoever. 
The hotel doesn’t serve breakfast but there are plenty of places nearby where you could go. And with Chinatown and Little Italy around the corner you also have plenty of options for lunch and dinner. We went shopping on Broadway, which is also walking distance from the hotel. And my daughter and I also went to a nice salon just two blocks from the hotel to get a pedicure and foot massage. Great way to recover when you’ve been walking so much! 
Oh, I almost forgot: the day we checked out, Iggy Pop (!!) sat in the lobby. If this rock and roll legend stays at the Sohotel then that makes the hotel legendary, doesn’t it ;)

title: A very nice experience!
text:
We loved the ambiance of the hotel and surroundings. The room was large, smelled lovely, nice lighting and decorated well. 
The mattresses need to be updated.
The restaurant below us was very loud late into the night.  I did not complain since it’s not owned by your company.  The coffee was good but real creamer would be preferred!

title: Super bien placé et très accueillant
text: Très bien placé, personnel sympa, très bien aménagé. Seul petit bémol sur les radiateurs un peu trop généreux et l’odeur de détergent un peu forte dans la chambre. Séjour très agréable même pour une famille de cinq dans une chambre unique.

title: Sohotel
text: I loved it i would stay again, very nice and affordable. Also located in a perfect area in lower Manhattan, plenty of food and bar choices on both east or west of location and close to chinatown and little italy as well. oh and the museum and plenty shopping close by

title: Excellent
text: We were in New York for a long weekend getaway. Last minute we decided to stay in the city. We stopped a few other hotels that were definitely not anywhere we would consider staying. When we arrived at Sohotel it was so nice and staff were very friendly. Our first thought was “this is going to cost a fortune”. However, much to our surprise rates were very reasonable. We really enjoyed our stay and hope to return soon!

title: Bowery’s best hotel
text: Staff is helpful and friendly, yet very efficient.  Rooms are clean and furnished, and very relaxing.  If you have shows to see or sites to visit, Sohotel is a great place to rest and freshen up. This was our 4th stay at Sohotel, and we look forward to a fifth.

title: Sohotel - great stay
text: Stayed at Sohotel for three nights with family. The hotel is very stylish, nice family room if a bit on the small side. Rooms have safe but no fridge. Staff are very helpful and their morning coffee is excellent. A good location too.

title: Leuk hotel.....totdat je uitcheckt
text: We waren hier van 3-2-2020 tot 10-2-2020. Hotel op zich is prima. Bij inchecken was er discussie over het type kamer wat we hadden geboekt maar na bewijsvoering van juiste boeking was alles in orde.... leek het. Bij uitchecken claimde men alsnog extra kosten en zelfs bijkomende kosten. Hoewel deze discussie nog steeds loopt, heeft men de bedragen al wel van de creditcard afgeschreven. We zijn nu 280 dollar meer kwijt en moeten maar zien hoe we ons geld terug krijgen. Schandalig en een nare afloop van een leuke week New York. Kijk dus goed wat je boekt en welke extra kosten je al betaald hebt, voor je het weet wordt het alsnog een duur verblijf.

title: Awesome!
text: Had a wonderful stay. Can’t say enough about the design and staff. Sohotel is my favorite hotel in Manhattan and I’ve stayed at over 100 hotels here. Every detail exceeds expectations. Can’t wait to return!

title: Home sweet home
text:
Excellent stay. I’ve visited and stayed here multiple times and every visit is better than the last. Staff is attentive and helpful. Price is reasonable and these rooms are spotless! My favorite part is the distinct smell in this establishment! Smells clean and fresh ALL OF THE TIME! This is the only
Place I stay when I visit NYC. Spacious rooms, close to restaurants and bars. WiFi is great!

title: We loved it!
text: Very friendly and helpful staff that helped us with luggage at check in and check out.  You’re able to store luggage before and after your stay so you can explore the city as much as possible.  Staff helped us use the subway and get around the city. Beds were super comfy and room had a refrigerator.  Shower had body wash, shampoo and conditioner dispensers, which is a really nice feature.  Morning coffee in the lobby was a nice touch!  Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others!

title: Nice but loud
text: The hotel was nice and clean. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Our only issue was that they have hotel rooms above the bar/night club. Our room was extremely loud and vibrated from the bass in the music. The bar finally stop playing music after 3 am. Then the partiers came to their hotel rooms n on both sides of our room. WE could hear everything that they were saying. No one in our room could sleep. It made the night and next morning miserable. The rooms above the bar should not be used for guest.

title: Small room, good rates and location.
text: Extremely small rooms but very clean. No Elevator. Very friendly and helpful staff. No kettle in the room for brew which was disappointing. Good location and room rates. Lots of places around for breakfast, lunch or coffee.

title: My new go to hotel is The Sohotel!
text: My new go to hotel is the Sohotel! I will only stay at The Sohotel when I come to New York City. The location, beautiful rooms, restaurants downstairs and outstanding staff make it easy to come back. Great job!

title: Loved it!
text: Found this hotel on a travel site. It was walking distance to my appointment at NYU and the price per night was well within my set limits. Called the front desk to find out parking fee was NYC reasonable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The decor was “youthful European.”  The neighborhood was filled with cool shops and restaurants. Looking forward to going back!

title: GOOD
text: well located in Soho, near Little Italy, Chinatown and Tribeca, near subway and any service needed like pub, supermarket, etc, staff very friendly and room very clean, we had family room for five peolple

title: Sohotel is the best
text: Thank you SoHotel for the great experience.  I upgraded to the nicer room on the 4th floor with two queen beds for just $30 a night more and was allowed to check in a few hours early after a long ten hour flight.  It really made a difference.  I had the friendliest service from the front desk offering me money saving tips.   Great experience overall.

title: 'The oldest operating hotel in New York city' - a stylish comfortable place to stay in an excellent location
text: We stayed one night in the Sohotel at the end of our trip to New York and New England.  I wish we had stayed longer.  The location - right on the border of Soho, Noho, Nolita, Chinatown and the Lower East side is excellent.  The hotel is stylish without being annoyingly funky or sacrificing comfort for style and while retaining the heritage feeling of the building.  The service is great with staff who ask questions that indicate they are actually interested in hearing what you are planning to do during your stay.  There are no elevators and a lot of stairs so if you have mobility issues this may not be the hotel for you.  Also while there are restaurants in the same building affiliated to the hotel there is no hotel restaurant or hotel room service as such - but given the location there are excellent interesting food places all around and the hotel provides a guide of some you might want to try.  I would definitely stay at Sohotel again.

title: Great value in this trendy interesting historic building
text: This hotel is near a lot of fun things to do and lots of great restaurants. The staff is courteous and the rooms are well appointed. The historic character of the building is interesting. We stayed on the 4th floor and we had to take the stairs....that was fine for us but might be tricky for the elderly.  There are rooms that accomodate 3 people also, which is unique in NYC and most convenient for a lot of people.

title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel
text:
We loved our stay here. Premium rooms are on 4th floor and well worth it. They are brand new rooms. Love the in floor heat in bathroom to keep your toes warm.
Ok so there is no elevator, but some one helps you bring your bags up. Reception is on 2nd floor so you are already part way there. Staircases are not that bad. The sitting areas in lobby are fun and playful. Very comfortable. Staff was friendly but not overzealous. They maybe could ask about your plans and make suggestions ( the only item for improvement). We did the valet parking which was convenient. Park your car and leave it because you can walk most places or take the subway. Very convenient location. Love SOHO! Just a couple blocks away from Little Italy and Chinatown!

title: Great hotel with character
text:
We were going to theRockwood music hall to see our favorite band, and we wanted a hotel near the venue.  We were pleasantly surprised how nice this hotel was.  Very friendly and helpful staff, and our room was clean and the bedding was very comfortable.  All the conveniences you need: Wifi, tv etc.  
I would highly recommend.

title: Heerlijk hotel
text:
Wij zijn hier met ons gezin 2x geweest: 1 keer in een kleine familiekamer (5p) en 1 keer in de grotere familiekamer. Het hotel heeft een goede ligging: dichtbij winkelstraten en temidden van een buurt met zeer uiteenlopende restaurants. Wij zijn bij 2 goede italiaanse restaurants geweest: waarvan 1 (Piacere) in dezelfde straat, nagenoeg naast het hotel gelegen is. Aanrader! Het hotel is sfeervol ingericht met op de begane grond en eerste verdieping enkele zithoeken en (gratis) koffie/thee. Het personeel is vriendelijk. 
De familiekamers hebben een koelkastje (minibar) op de kamer. Er is geen mogelijkheid voor ontbijt in het hotel maar er zijn goede ontbijttentjes om de hoek (oa Cafe Integral, Egg Shop en The Butchers daughter; goede originele ontbijtjes maar wel iets prijzig). 
Samengevat: prima hotel, leuke locatie en goede prijs/kwaliteit verhouding.

title: Great Hotel
text: This little hotel hotel has great service, great location for a good price in NYC. The staff is super helpful and kind, always willing to help. Wifi works perfectly. There are no breakfast options but you can find complementary coffee, tea, hot chocolate in the lobby during most of the day/night. There are also a couple of vending machines for a quick snack, and you can find great breakfast options close by. Downside there is no elevator but don’t worry about your bags, the staff will bring them to your room. Rooms are veeery small, so don’t plan on bringing a bunch of bags, still you can manage (we were a group of 5 adults with 5 big bags all in the same room and we still fit, a little crowded but manageable) beds are very confortable, and the bathroom i ok in size, very nice and clean. Overall a wonderful stay.

title: Superb value for money and great hotel
text: In great area of lower Manhattan with loads of local cafes and restuarants in all the side streets minutes from the hotel. Immaculately clean and lovely design and decor.  Great shower room. Coffee/Tea in reception area available and nice areas to sit and chill.  Would highly recommend.

title: Full value
text: Second year in a row staying here over the holidays.  SOHO is the place to be in NYC. Hotel is great - cool decor, great service and easy access (by foot or train) to everything - food, shopping, entertainment.

title: Sleepless in the city
text: Hotel was cute but in a loud neighborhood- my room was by the street and as a result extremely loud at night, all night. I was woken up by other guests , sirens, partiers, trucks, kitchen staff, you name it. Worst 2 nights sleep I have ever received in a hotel.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Our new favorite hotel in New York. The hotel has great ambiance, texture, character, and location. The staff is outstanding and took care of our every need. Even more importantly, they had something to offer. Instead of a soulless corporate drone, each staff member we encountered had soul, empathy, depth, character. We were staying in the hotel for two separate business trips—my wife’s and mine—as well as for having family join us in a pre holiday gathering. That’s complicated. The staff was understanding at a basic human level and made it a stay we will never forget. And at the same time, they got their jobs done with efficiency and verve. I’ve never seen anything quite like it. I hope the hotel management rewards and retains them. Relatedly, the hotel itself has great character—from its historical heritage to the preservation of its brick walls and quirky spaces and creative use of natural light and recycled wood and multiple levels.
